title: Pricing Analyst
description: \n          Site Name: UK - London - BrentfordPosted Date: Mar 18 2024Senior Finance Analyst, Corporate DevelopmentLocation: GSK House, Brentford \xe2\x80\x93 Tottenham Court Road\xe2\x80\x98We\xe2\x80\x99re moving towards a more sustainable future with our new headquarters. With better public transport links and proximity to world-class science and technology institutions, we\xe2\x80\x99re excited for our move to the vicinity of Earnshaw Street, London WC1A (\xe2\x80\x9cthe New HQ\xe2\x80\x9d) by end H1 2024.\xe2\x80\x99 Job PurposeThe Global Corporate Development team, reporting to the VP & Head of Corporate Development, comprises :10 professional staff based in London/ Philadelphia plus administrative support. The team is part of the wider Global Corporate Development group that reports to the President, Corporate Development.The Corporate Development team manages a fast-moving portfolio of strategic projects on behalf of the SVP Global Corporate Development and members of the Global Leadership Team (GLT). These strategic projects mostly relate to acquisition or sale of companies or brands by GSK as well as R&D licensing agreements. These transactions range in value from a few \xc2\xa3\xe2\x80\x99m to in excess of \xc2\xa31bn. Each project is unique, but all are highly confidential as they have the potential to directly impact the share price of GSK and other companies.As the Senior Finance Analyst, Corporate Development you will be responsible for\xe2\x80\xa6Supporting Corporate Development projects (eventually with the prospect of leading smaller deals as you gain experience). This is a high-profile role, which will require close interaction with GLT members, external advisers, and other senior management.It requires strong financial and evaluation skills together with a broad understanding of the company\xe2\x80\x99s business and the industry in which it operates. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, an innovative and \xe2\x80\x9cself-starter\xe2\x80\x9d approach, an ability to deliver high quality product to tight deadlines, excellent prioritisation skills, managing ambiguity and total flexibility of response to changing business requirements are critical to success in this role. Some transaction or equity markets exposure would be expected at Grade 6, although high-potential candidates without this experience will also be considered at an initial Grade 7.Key ResponsibilitiesAccountability:The Senior Finance Analyst will be required to act as a business partner to many and varied groups from all divisions of GSK and will liaise directly with senior representatives from these groups, working as part of a team. Corporate Development projects typically involve the valuation of a target company using a range of public sources, analysis of the financial impact of acquisition on GSK and the preparation of briefing documents for a GLT audience. The projects may require the Senior Finance Analyst to assist in financial due diligence.Support the Directors of Corporate Development in managing their own project workload. Specifically, the Senior Finance Analyst will (often under very tight time constraints) be required to build, develop, and maintain very complex spreadsheet models and to present outputs clearly and in a highly professional format.Other occasional duties may include for example (i) the preparation of valuations relating to impairment testing of goodwill, intangible assets and entity carrying values, (ii) benchmarking against competitors (iii) the preparation and updating of reports on the GSK target universe and competitor products (iv) making recommendations on corporate actions in relation to GSK\xe2\x80\x99s equity investments and (v) maintenance and improvement of the team\xe2\x80\x99s standard business combination and other financial modelsComplexity:The Corporate Development and Strategy teams work routinely with Global Leadership Team members and senior management from all parts of the business. These customers have high expectations and demand high quality output in short time frames. In order to build and maintain credibility the Senior Finance Analyst must demonstrate close attention to detail, the ability to get things right first time and excellent project management skills. In addition, the Senior Finance Analyst must respond flexibly to rapidly changing priorities and timelines and be comfortable with a high degree of organisational ambiguity.Why You?Basic QualificationsUndergraduate degree OR equivalent experienceDemonstrable experience in finance and/or accounting \xe2\x80\x93 this could be gained in house or consultancy workDemonstrated ability to use basic valuation techniques including discounted cash flow (NPV) analysisStrong analytical skills and ability to gather, analyse, simplify, and summarise detailed and complex information from a range of sources. Expert proficiency in Excel and good PowerPoint skillsAbility to build partnerships across all departments e.g., Corporate Finance, Global Manufacturing and Supply, Legal, Commercial, R&DHigh level of confidentiality requiredPreferred QualificationsQualified ACA/ CIMA accountantDeveloping knowledge of and interest in the dynamics of the pharmaceutical industry and what drives valuationsAccuracy with strong attention to detail.Ability to plan and work effectively to often short timelines and flexibility to cope with changing priorities at short notice.Ability to understand and adapt working style to suit different situationsAbility to exercise high levels of judgment.Knowledge of Unison/Bison at a Corporate level and corporate structure; able to extract financial data from systemsWhy GSK?GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose \xe2\x80\x93 to unite science, technology, and talent to get ahead of disease together \xe2\x80\x93 so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns \xe2\x80\x93 as an organisation where people can thrive.Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it, and we aim to impact the health of 2.5 billion people around the world in the next 10 years. Our R&D focus is to deliver a new generation of vaccines and medicines using the science of the immune system, human genetics, and advanced technologies to get ahead of infectious diseases, HIV, cancer, and other immune-mediated and respiratory diseases. We do all this with a commitment to operate responsibly for all our stakeholders by prioritising Innovation, Performance and Trust.Our bold ambitions for patients are reflected in new commitments to growth and a significant step-change in delivery over the next five years. This means more GSK vaccines and medicines, including innovative new products, will reach more people who need them than ever before.We have long believed that building trust is key to stronger performance, helping to create value for shareholders, impact for patients and society and a reason outstanding people choose to work for and with us. That is why being a responsible business is an integral part of our strategy. Taking action on environmental, social and governance issues is a key driver in our strategy.Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it is also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a place where people feel inspired, encouraged, and challenged to be the best they can be. A place where they can be themselves \xe2\x80\x93 feeling welcome, valued, and included. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead TogetherClosing Date for Applications: 05/04/2024 (COB)Please take a copy of the Job Description, as this will not be available post closure of the advert.When applying for this role, please use the \xe2\x80\x98cover letter\xe2\x80\x99 of the online application or your CV to describe how you meet the competencies for this role, as outlined in the job requirements above. The information that you have provided in your cover letter and CV will be used to assess your application.LI-GSKWhy Us?GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose \xe2\x80\x93 to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together \xe2\x80\x93 so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns \xe2\x80\x93 as an organization where people can thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it, and we aim to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of 2030.Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it\xe2\x80\x99s also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a workplace where everyone can feel a sense of belonging and thrive as set out in our Equal and Inclusive Treatment of Employees policy. We\xe2\x80\x99re committed to being more proactive at all levels so that our workforce reflects the communities we work and hire in, and our GSK leadership reflects our GSK workforce.As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are open to all talent. In the US, we also adhere to Affirmative Action principles. This ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to neurodiversity, race/ethnicity, colour, national origin, religion, gender, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class*(*US only).We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on Ukdiversity.recruitment@gsk.com or 0808 234 4391.Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments, we will not be able to support you through these channels. However, we have created a UK Recruitment FAQ guide. Click the link and scroll to the Careers Section where you will find answers to multiple questions we receiveAs you apply, we will ask you to share some personal information which is entirely voluntary. We want to have an opportunity to consider a diverse pool of qualified candidates and this information will assist us in meeting that objective and in understanding how well we are doing against our inclusion and diversity ambitions. We would really appreciate it if you could take a few moments to complete it. Rest assured, Hiring Managers do not have access to this information and we will treat your information confidentially.Important notice to Employment businesses/ AgenciesGSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK\'s commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK\xe2\x80\x99s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit GSK\xe2\x80\x99s Transparency Reporting For the Record site.We\xe2\x80\x99re moving towards a more sustainable future with our new headquarters. With better public transport links and proximity to world-class science and technology institutions, we\xe2\x80\x99re excited for our move to the vicinity of Earnshaw Street, London WC1A (\xe2\x80\x9cthe New HQ\xe2\x80\x9d) by end H1 2024.\n

It\'s a unique opportunity to join one of Hopper\'s strategic lodging team, and get access to fascinating and massive market and behavioural data sets.Your main responsibility will revolve around taking charge of our data warehousing, ensuring data accessibility, and delivering insights that will shape our strategic direction.In this role you will be part of a cross-functional team of product managers, data scientists, and engineers who work closely together to make travel easier and reach millions of users in the process.What Would Your Day-to-day Look LikeInitiate, Develop, and Maintain Data Pipelines: Independently drive the creation and maintenance of data pipelines crucial for data-driven decision-making. Ensure these pipelines are robust, efficient, and consistently updated to provide real-time insights.Data Warehouse Ownership: Take full ownership of our data warehouse, making it an accessible and user-friendly resource for product and commercial teams. Streamline data storage, retrieval, and organization to empower teams with actionable insights.KPI Metrics and Reporting Frameworks: Identify, refine, and track key performance indicators (KPIs) critical to assessing business performance. Develop and maintain reporting frameworks that allow for continuous monitoring and reporting of these metrics.Core Reporting for Decision-Making: Create and manage core reporting systems that drive both daily operational decisions and long-term strategic ones. Ensure that these reports provide actionable insights and are readily available to relevant stakeholders.Revenue Growth Opportunities: By becoming an expert in our data and understanding our customers thoroughly, proactively identify new opportunities for revenue growth. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement strategies that capitalize on these opportunities.Autonomy in Problem-Solving: Identify data-related challenges and develop creative solutions independently. Demonstrate a proactive approach to problem-solving and a commitment to data quality and accuracy.We are looking for someone who has a real bias for action, takes ownership, thrives on autonomy and delivers results.An Ideal Candidate Has+5 years of experience thriving in a fast pace business intelligence focused roleA proven track record of solving complex problems with an in-depth understanding of data, product, and business impactHigh attention to detail and ability to create scalable data solutionsFluency in using SQL for data creation, maintenance, and analysisExperience with data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Amplitude, Big Query)Demonstrated expertise in maintaining data quality, integrity, and compliance with data governance best practices.Worked on a consumer product and has shipped high-impact models at scaleStrong experience, knowledge of, and/or keen interest in marketplace pricing and inventory.Strong creative problem-solving skills and critical thinking competenciesExperience in launching, analyzing, and setting frameworks for A/B tests.Perks Of Working With UsWell-funded and proven startup with large ambitions, competitive salary, stock optionsAutomatic contributions when you start with Hopper through Smart Pension (match up to 3%*)Unlimited PTOPuzl coworking All Access Pass OR Work-from-home stipendEntrepreneurial culture where pushing limits and taking risks is everyday businessOpen communication with management and company leadershipSmall, dynamic teams = massive impact100% employer-paid health and dental insurance plans#posttoexternalMore About HopperAt Hopper, we are on a mission to become the leading travel platform globally \xe2\x80\x93 powering Hopper\xe2\x80\x99s mobile app, website and our B2B business, HTS (Hopper Technology Solutions). By leveraging massive amounts of data and advanced machine learning algorithms, Hopper combines its world-class travel agency offering with proprietary fintech products to bring transparency, flexibility and savings to travelers globally. We have developed several unique fintech solutions that address everything from pricing volatility to trip disruptions \xe2\x80\x93 helping people travel better and save more on their trips.The Hopper platform serves hundreds of millions of travelers globally and continues to capture market share around the world. Ranked the third largest online travel agency in North America, the Hopper app has been downloaded over 120 million times and has become largely popular among younger travelers \xe2\x80\x93 with 70% of its users being Gen Z and millennials.While everyone knows us as the Gen Z and Millennial travel app, Hopper has evolved to become much more than that. In recent years, we\xe2\x80\x99ve grown into a global travel agency and travel fintech provider that powers some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest brands.Through HTS, our B2B division, the company supercharges its partners\xe2\x80\x99 direct channels by integrating our fintech products on their sites or powering end-to-end travel portals. Today, our partners include leading travel brands like Capital One, Nubank, Air Canada and many more.Here are just a few stats that demonstrate the company\xe2\x80\x99s recent growth:Hopper sells billion worth of travel and travel fintech every year. In 2023, over 1.3 billion trips were planned through the Hopper app and our HTS partnerships.Our fintech products \xe2\x80\x93 including Price Freeze, Flexibility for Any Reason and Flight Disruption Assistance \xe2\x80\x93 have exceptionally strong CSAT because the terms are always clear, and customers receive instant, no-questions-asked resolutions.Almost 30% of our app customers purchase at least one fintech product when making a booking; and consumers are 1.6x more likely to repurchase if they add fintech to their booking vs if they booked just travel.Given the success of its fintech products, Hopper launched a B2B initiative, HTS (Hopper Technology Solutions), which represents more than 50% of the business.Through HTS, any travel provider (airlines, hotels, banks, travel agencies, etc.) can integrate and seamlessly distribute Hopper\xe2\x80\x99s fintech or travel inventory on their direct channels. As its first HTS partnership, the company partnered with Capital One to co-develop Capital One Travel, a new travel portal designed specifically for cardholders. Other HTS partners include Air Canada, Uber, CommBank, Nubank, Flair Airlines with many more in the pipeline.Featured in Apple\xe2\x80\x99s Best of the App Store list of Essential Travel Apps in 2023 and recognized by the likes of Fast Company\xe2\x80\x99s Most Innovative Companies, Hopper has been downloaded over 120 million times and continues to have millions of new installs each month. Hopper is now the #3 largest online travel agency in North America and 70% of our app customers are Gen-Z and millennials travelers.Hopper has raised over $750 million USD of private capital and is backed by some of the largest institutional investors and banks in the world. Hopper is primed to continue its acceleration as the world\xe2\x80\x99s fastest-growing mobile-first travel marketplace.Come take off with us!\n

title: Senior pricing Analyst - Remote
description: \n          Senior Analyst e-CommerceReports to: Senior Commercial & Trading Performance Manager About usThe Independent is an online news publisher that was established in 1986 as a national newspaper independent of party-political affiliations or proprietorial influence. In 2016, The Independent became a fully digital publisher, moving away from print in pursuit of sustainability, and to safeguard its values and journalism for the future.The Independent has always thrived through innovation and change. It was the first British newspaper to add a Saturday magazine; the first to give photography the same prestige as a news copy; the first to challenge the Westminster lobby system of closed briefings; the first broadsheet to move to the more compact \xe2\x80\x98tabloid\xe2\x80\x99 format; the first to launch a concise quality compact paper; and the first \xe2\x80\x93 and only \xe2\x80\x93 major newspaper to pull off a successful transformation to fully digital publishing. Through The Independent, Independent TV, eCommerce, indy100, subscriptions and other reader revenues, The Independent plans to continue the work of many decades, bringing much-needed independent journalism to over 100 million unique global visitors a month, make its voice ever louder and more insistent the world over. We have an international editorial team with our main offices in London and New York.Job purposeThe purpose of the role is to work closely with the eCommerce team to provide accurate and up-to-date reporting and analysis of all eCommerce activities, together with insights and recommendations for revenue improvements, strategic growth and efficiencies.About youAn accomplished data analyst with proven experience in e-Commerce.Interested in working in the mediaExcellent interpersonal and communication skills when dealing with internal stakeholders.Requirement to be self-motivated, highly organised and able to work to demanding deadlines.A willingness to continuously improve, being adaptable and agile to align working methods with the needs of the business.The TeamThe Independent Data & Marketing department provides a centralised service to the business in areas that include analytics, engineering and data architecture, commercial data, subscriptions and CRM strategy, registrations, customer success, design and privacy compliance.  One section of the data department is focused on supporting the growth in reader revenues through subscriptions, donations and eCommerce. This role will sit in the Reader Revenues team to support the growth of our expanding eCommerce arm.Diversity, Equity and InclusionWe champion diversity in our teams and in our reporting. As a growing and global brand, we must have a workforce that\xe2\x80\x99s more representative of our readers, viewers, clients and partners, and a workplace that creates a sense of belonging for everyone.We are committed to hiring and developing a diverse workforce regardless of background, and we support our people to thrive in their careers here.The Independent is an equal opportunities employer, if you require any reasonable adjustments to complete your application, please do not hesitate to advise us accordingly.Key responsibilities and accountabilities Deliver reports and analysis on the performance of content, products, revenue and commission across all of the eCommerce verticals.Utilise knowledge of the sector to provide tactical and strategic direction and support where necessaryWork with the eCommerce team during any new business development pitches to ensure that data provision is at the forefront of discussions and negotiations.Work with the eCommerce team during the onboarding processes of external partners to ensure they are providing the relevant information for reporting and analysis. Manage and develop a direct report (Data Analyst).Support a variety of eCommerce stakeholders, from junior journalists to the ceo, together with other areas of the business as and when required, for example the Marketing & CRM team, Commercial Data, Finance and Editorial.Assist the content planning and assessment process by providing editorial insight for areas of the site with an eCommerce offering.Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using Python, SQL and GCP big data technologies. Utilise our BI tool Domo to provide the business with a comprehensive set of dashboards around eCommerce. Liaise with senior stakeholders to agree KPIs.Work closely with the Data Engineering team to ensure the quality and integrity of the eCommerce datasets.Handle all data securely and responsibly, observing the Data Protection Act and Company Code of Conduct.SkillsEssential+3 years proven experience in analytics, strategy or business development in the eCommerce sector.Educated to degree level or have at least 3 years relevant analytical/trading & performance experience. \xc2\xb7 Proficient using Excel / Google Sheets and PowerPoint/Google Slides.Experience of BI tools such as Looker, Power BY, Tableau or Domo.Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.Strong attention to detail.Excellent problem-solving skills.Curiosity and a questioning nature.DesirableThe ability to work on multiple projects and manage conflicting demands.An understanding of business applications of data.Experience with Google Analytics / Adobe Analytics.Experience with SQL.Experience in CRO (Conversion Rate Optimisation).Experience of managing a junior analyst.Our values \xe2\x80\x93 you will deliver across all our values. Inclusive: We champion diversity in our teams and in our reporting. Working as a team, we put transparency and effective communication at the heart of everything we do. Innovative: From the very beginning, The Independent has been breaking the mould. We take risks and are always looking to try new ideas in pursuit of excellence. Independent: Nobody tells us what to think; we make up our own minds and aren\xe2\x80\x99t afraid to do things differently. Like our readers, we value honesty and integrity above outside influences.\n

title: Junior, Data Entry Assistant (Remote)
description: \n          Company Description Informa is a leading international events, intelligence, and scholarly research group. Through hundreds of powerful brands, we work with businesses and professionals in specialist markets, providing the connections, intelligence and opportunities that help customers grow, do business, make breakthroughs, and take better informed decisions. Informa is listed on London Stock Exchange and a member of FTSE 100, with over 12,000 colleagues working in more than 30 countries. Informa\xe2\x80\x99s divisions include: Informa Connect , Informa Markets , Informa Tech , Taylor & Francis and Global Support . Informa is a successful and diverse business that has been built over the past twenty years through a mix of organic growth and acquisition. Informa is transforming itself to increase digital capability and the mix of revenues, with the expectation that far higher proportions of revenue are derived from new digital products and through the sales of all products through digital channels. As a contemporary B2B provider of solutions and services, we anticipate the need to enable customer touchpoints through digitalising processes that are currently offline, and through shaping and establishing a digital ecosystem over the next 5 years, whilst firmly establishing our position within it, thereby providing our B2B customers with end-to-end go-to-market solutions. This has resulted in strategic programmes like GAP II, focused on a digital acceleration and associated investment and the Unifying Technology Programme, focused on transforming the Technology Operating Model. Global Support and the Commercial Office Remit Global Support is Informa\xe2\x80\x99s fifth division, with major service hubs in the United Kingdom, the United States, Hong Kong, and Singapore as well as several smaller locations.Global Support colleagues provide shared, efficient business services and function-specific expertise to each of Informa\xe2\x80\x99s operating divisions, enabling our commercial teams to focus on their markets and customers. Technology Solutions & Services is a key function within Global Support, with responsibility for the management and evolution of the key enterprise technology disciplines that underpin day to day business operations including Strategy & Technology Change, Enterprise Architecture, Enterprise Technology, Customer Technology, Technology Operations, and Information Security. The Technology function is embarking on a clear roadmap for the modernisation of legacy services whilst developing new platforms, solutions and techniques that transform the TS&S team into an enabler of reliable, scalable and secure services that support Informa\xe2\x80\x99s digital agenda and diverse customer landscape, through the Unifying Technology Programme. We recognise the need for change and have a good understanding of where we need to get to. We need people to help us shape, solve problems and deliver the change agenda. Ensuring that we are seen as a trusted partner to our business colleagues. Successful candidates will be ready to be Customer-focused, collaborative and growth focused. Real Estate: the RE team oversees Informa\xe2\x80\x99s office landscape, with c.130 offices across the globe. The team of 34 is directly responsible for the day-to-day running, budgets, and leases of Informa\xe2\x80\x99s major shared office locations (e.g. London, Dubai, New York etc.) as well as oversight and support of divisionally owned offices. The team has accountability for managing Informa\xe2\x80\x99s 156 leases, as well as overseeing projects to refurbish and relocate offices as required. Currently, a proportion of the estate is being adapted to reflect Informa\'s balanced working approach, with Amsterdam and 5 Howick Place, reflecting the new design and model. Job Description Role Overview: Pricing expertise is a new competency we are building within Informa Plc. Informa Connect is a division within Informa selling events, media, and subscriptions. The pricing analyst role is a new one which will contribute to the company\'s financial success by ensuring that pricing decisions are data-driven and aligned with the organisation\'s goal of applying value-based pricing strategies to increase revenue and improve margin. This role is part of the central support team and will work closely with brands to influence and support their pricing decisions Key Responsibilities: Support the Pricing Sign off Process for Informa Connect\xe2\x80\x99s Top revenue producers (Millionaire\xe2\x80\x99s Club \xe2\x80\x93 MC Events.) Liaise with key stakeholders and teams to maintain weekly tracker of sign off progress to ensure ability to achieve sign off timelines. Organise briefing meetings where needed to ensure all key stakeholders are aligned and clear on responsibilities. Work closely with the data team to develop timelines for data requirements and to streamline the data inputs. Review all data for accuracy and insights before circulating to key stakeholders. Support the sales teams in their review of the inventory and setting price recommendations. Monitor and evaluate pricing and revenue performance. Develop and maintain reports which track key pricing metrics such as recommended versus implemented price and implemented versus achieved price. Support the identification and development of additional key metrics. Support development & deployment of frameworks. Brief teams on use of pricing calculator to ensure understanding and good adoption. Support development of new frameworks such as Pricing Calculator Variations (e.g. B2C) and package frameworks Conduct analysis as required to support price recommendations such as benchmarking core products, Delegate Pricing analysis, etc... Qualifications Proven experience (5+ years) as a Pricing Analyst or similar role in a complex and dynamic business environment. Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, or other statistical software. Solid understanding of pricing strategies, market dynamics, and revenue management principles. Ability to interpret and manipulate large datasets, and derive actionable insights. Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and make data-driven decisions. This posting will automatically expire on March 15, 2024. Additional Information Why work at Informa? Employee experience is very important to us at Informa. On top of joining a supportive, diverse and ambitious team that welcomesall types of candidates.We are alsoflexiblewithdifferent working patternsandprioritize promotions internally. Our benefits include:Freedom & flexibility: colleagues rate us highly for the flexibility and trust they receive and most of us balance time in the office with time working remotelyGreat community: a welcoming culture with in-person and online social events, our fantastic Walk the World charity day and active diversity and inclusion networksBroader impact: take up to four days per year to volunteer, with charity match funding available tooCareer opportunity: the opportunity to develop your career with bespoke training and learning, mentoring platforms and on-demand access to thousands of courses on LinkedIn Learning. When it\xe2\x80\x99s time for the next step, we encourage and support internal job movesTime out: 25 days annual leave, rising to 27 days after two years, plus a birthday leave day and the chance to work from (almost!) anywhere for up to four weeks a yearA flexible range of personal benefits to choose from, plus company funded private medical coverA ShareMatch scheme that allows you to become an Informa shareholder with free matching sharesStrong wellbeing support through EAP assistance, mental health first aiders, a healthy living subsidy, access to health apps and moreRecognition for great work, with global awards and kudos programmesAs an international company, the chance to collaborate with teams around the world We know that sometimes the \'perfect candidate\' doesn\'t exist, and that people can be put off applying for a job if they don\'t fit all the requirements. If you\'re excited about working for us and have most of the skills or experience we\'re looking for, please go ahead and apply. You could be just what we need! We believe strongly in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed. As such, Informa is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship, or other protected characteristics under federal, state or local law. Please let us know of any adjustments we need to make for you to show us your best self. We want all of our candidates to shine in the recruitment process! dynamic teams = massive impact100% employer-paid health and dental insurance plansPension plan employer match#posttoexternalMore About HopperAt Hopper, we are on a mission to become the leading travel platform globally \xe2\x80\x93 powering Hopper\xe2\x80\x99s mobile app, website and our B2B business, HTS (Hopper Technology Solutions). By leveraging massive amounts of data and advanced machine learning algorithms, Hopper combines its world-class travel agency offering with proprietary fintech products to bring transparency, flexibility and savings to travelers globally. We have developed several unique fintech solutions that address everything from pricing volatility to trip disruptions \xe2\x80\x93 helping people travel better and save more on their trips.The Hopper platform serves hundreds of millions of travelers globally and continues to capture market share around the world. Ranked the third largest online travel agency in North America, the Hopper app has been downloaded over 120 million times and has become largely popular among younger travelers \xe2\x80\x93 with 70% of its users being Gen Z and millennials.While everyone knows us as the Gen Z and Millennial travel app, Hopper has evolved to become much more than that. In recent years, we\xe2\x80\x99ve grown into a global travel agency and travel fintech provider that powers some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest brands.Through HTS, our B2B division, the company supercharges its partners\xe2\x80\x99 direct channels by integrating our fintech products on their sites or powering end-to-end travel portals. Today, our partners include leading travel brands like Capital One, Nubank, Air Canada and many more.Here are just a few stats that demonstrate the company\xe2\x80\x99s recent growth:Hopper sells billion worth of travel and travel fintech every year. In 2023, over 1.3 billion trips were planned through the Hopper app and our HTS partnerships.Our fintech products \xe2\x80\x93 including Price Freeze, Flexibility for Any Reason and Flight Disruption Assistance \xe2\x80\x93 have exceptionally strong CSAT because the terms are always clear, and customers receive instant, no-questions-asked resolutions.Almost 30% of our app customers purchase at least one fintech product when making a booking; and consumers are 1.6x more likely to repurchase if they add fintech to their booking vs if they booked just travel.Given the success of its fintech products, Hopper launched a B2B initiative, HTS (Hopper Technology Solutions), which represents more than 50% of the business.Through HTS, any travel provider (airlines, hotels, banks, travel agencies, etc.) can integrate and seamlessly distribute Hopper\xe2\x80\x99s fintech or travel inventory on their direct channels. As its first HTS partnership, the company partnered with Capital One to co-develop Capital One Travel, a new travel portal designed specifically for cardholders. Other HTS partners include Air Canada, Uber, CommBank, Nubank, Flair Airlines with many more in the pipeline.Featured in Apple\xe2\x80\x99s Best of the App Store list of Essential Travel Apps in 2023 and recognized by the likes of Fast Company\xe2\x80\x99s Most Innovative Companies, Hopper has been downloaded over 120 million times and continues to have millions of new installs each month. Hopper is now the #3 largest online travel agency in North America and 70% of our app customers are Gen-Z and millennials travelers.Hopper has raised over $750 million USD of private capital and is backed by some of the largest institutional investors and banks in the world. Hopper is primed to continue its acceleration as the world\xe2\x80\x99s fastest-growing mobile-first travel marketplace.Come take off with us!\n

title: Digital Product Manager
description: \n          Company DescriptionWise is a global technology company, building the best way to move and manage the world\xe2\x80\x99s money. Min fees. Max ease. Full speed.Whether people and businesses are sending money to another country, spending abroad, or making and receiving international payments, Wise is on a mission to make their life easier and save them money.As part of our team, you will be helping us create an entirely new network for the world\'s money. For everyone, everywhere. More about our mission.Job DescriptionWe\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a Senior Product Manager - Onboarding to join our growing team in London. This role is a unique opportunity to have an impact on Wise\xe2\x80\x99s mission, grow as a product person, and help save millions for our customers around the world.Your MissionWise has already pioneered new ways for people to transfer money across borders and currencies. Our customers can also manage their hard-earned money with the world\xe2\x80\x99s first platform to offer true multi-currency banking.Here\xe2\x80\x99s How You\xe2\x80\x99ll Be ContributingThe role of the onboarding team is to drive growth of Wise by making our customers\' first experience sending, receiving and spending money as convenient as possible, across web and mobile.You and the team are able to iterate on any aspect of our products across platforms without ever compromising on transparency.Your role is to find and iterate on opportunities to grow Wise faster, bringing more customers to the revolution. Success is currently measured by tracking the conversion rates of new customers globally across all our products.You\xe2\x80\x99ll be working closely with Designers, Researchers, Developers and Analysts and you\xe2\x80\x99ll enable the team to make informed decisions and inspire the highest standards of execution.You\xe2\x80\x99ll report to the onboarding & growth product lead, whose role is to help you find your own path to having a big impact on the Wise mission.This Role Will Give You The Opportunity ToDirectly contribute to our mission to make money without borders the new normal \xe2\x80\x93 you will need to figure out and build solutions so that our customers can move money instantly, conveniently, transparently, and \xe2\x80\x93 eventually \xe2\x80\x93 for freeBuild world-class products: The role is a unique opportunity to build innovative, state-of-the-art solutions with a global impact.Choose your path to impact \xe2\x80\x93 we believe people are most empowered when they can act autonomously. Of course, you can always gather feedback from smart, curious people across Wise but you\xe2\x80\x99ll have the freedom to make your own callsGrow as a leader \xe2\x80\x93 You will build and inspire your own team, but also other teams to contribute to our mission.Inspire teams with your ideas, knowledge and self-starting attitudeA Bit About YouYou are able to get the team to dream big, align on a commonly agreed vision and draw a clear path to get there.Customer-focus \xe2\x80\x93 You\xe2\x80\x99ve worked on a product with thousands or even millions of customers, ran surveys or research and interviewed people who used your product. You\xe2\x80\x99re able to define the customer impact of product investments you make.You have a track record of delivering excellent user experience on web, iOS and Android. You have a strong sense of UX and a strict attention to UI details.You\xe2\x80\x99re data-driven \xe2\x80\x93 You are able to dive into data to identify opportunities and then measure your impact. You prioritise the value you can add to customers, and can get the entire company behind you by telling stories with data.You have a good technical understanding - help your team prioritise technological investments, tech debt reduction, bugs and new features.Communicating clearly and logically \xe2\x80\x93 You are able to effectively frame problems to influence across the team. You don\xe2\x80\x99t stick to a \xe2\x80\x9cby the book\xe2\x80\x9d product manager role definition. You get it done.Some Extra Skills That Would Be GreatDesign skills are a bonus.Additional InformationFor everyone, everywhere.
