We have created a new organisation with diverse professionals that come from a wide set of skills, backgrounds, and experiences, including b2b and b2c businesses.Team members have broad autonomy to collaborate and work in a cross-functional way and we value your opinion in every matter; so, if you are a product manager and you want to get into design work, - please do! Or an engineer and want to do user testing - go for it! Teams own their work end-to-end and we have a flat organisational structure.Our inclusive culture is hugely important to us, and we are looking for intellectually curious, compassionate people who would like to expand their skills whilst working on an exciting new venture for the firm. We are about bringing new products to market that solve real world problems for real life customers, not just innovation for the sake of innovation. We are human first; we love working with each other, and we need personal connections and in-person bonding. We find we are happier, more motivated, and more productive this way. If this sounds like something that you would like to be a part of, we\'d encourage you to read on and apply. Even if the job description isn\'t an exact match for you, we promise to review your application and let you know if there is anything that might be suitable in the future!Role overviewWe are looking for a Product Manager to design and implement complex systems relating to customer profile and state management solutions, preferably for digital small business banking products.Core ResponsibilitiesDefining product requirements for a small business customer profile and lifecycle managementModel, build and implement services related to customer profile and related partiesBuild and implement customer lifecycle states and associated processes Ensure that all upstream and downstream services are integrated with our servicesModel, build and implement a single customer (retail or small business) view across markets and line of businesses Ensure that all the customer journeys impacted by our services are operationally ready with the appropriate process workflows agreed with stakeholdersDesign and implement a permission and entitlements framework considering entity relationships and lifecycle statesEssential Skills/experienceSeveral years of experience in product development i.e. going through a full product lifecycle from identifying a market need to post launch execution preferably in a multi-market and multi-product landscapeFamiliarity with different types of small business profiles, such as sole traders and limited companies, and their interaction models with banking servicesExperience working with large complex data sets and data modelling Working knowledge of UK and Europe regulatory requirements related to customer data management in banking sector, including data privacy laws, KYC regulations and AML policies in UK marketUnderstanding of the lifecycle of small business banking customer particularly in the areas of customer relationship management, regulatory compliance, and fraud managementExcellent problem solving abilities to address challenges related to data integration, regulatory compliance, and customer data management Collaboration skill to work effectively with cross functional teams. Ability to handle multiple, conflicting priorities and deadlines without compromising quality ABOUT USJ.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world\xe2\x80\x99s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants\xe2\x80\x99 and employees\xe2\x80\x99 religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.About The TeamOur professionals in our Corporate Functions cover a diverse range of areas from finance and risk to human resources and marketing. Our corporate teams are an essential part of our company, ensuring that we\xe2\x80\x99re setting our businesses, clients, customers and employees up for success.\n

title: Product Owner / Capability & Industry Specialist
description: \n          About Northern Trust: Northern Trust, a Fortune 500 company, is a globally recognized, award-winning financial institution that has been in continuous operation since 1889.Northern Trust is proud to provide innovative financial services and guidance to the world\'s most successful individuals, families, and institutions by remaining true to our enduring principles of service, expertise, and integrity. With more than 130 years of financial experience and over 22,000 partners, we serve the world\'s most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.Role / Department:Asset Servicing, Global Payments & Cash Management, Capability & Industry, Specialist, Product Owner - Business Analysis.The role is required to drive forward on a day-to-day basis Products within Asset Servicing, Capability & Industry, Global Cash & Payments. The Product Owner provides ownership of the product backlog. Works closely with the Product Manager to understand the business needs and objectives and translate them into high-quality EPICs and Stories. The Product Owner acts as the first point of contact for development, testing and solutions as the work progresses through the delivery methodology.The key responsibilities of the role include :Product StrategyWork with business stakeholders and Product Managers to understand the initial strategy and business vision of the Product(s).Product DesignTake complex client and business needs and provide high-level requirements, design expectations and success criteria. Work closely with other Product Managers, other Product Owners, and Architecture Solutions during this early phase. A balance between ideal vision and a pragmatic route to deliver early client and business benefits will be a core design principle.Product PlanningInput into and participate in Program Increment Planning sessions to help set the priorities of the releases.Product DeliveryAs the Product moves through the process into delivery ensure that close contact is maintained and the appropriate support is given to the Solutions Architects, Testers and Developers to ensure that eventual Product outcome meets the desired success criteria.Product ConsultantBe the point of contact for the business on matters related to the Product in questions. Stay up to date on market events related to the Product and ensure that industry trends are incorporated into the ongoing Product roadmap thinking.The successful candidate will benefit from having:Market Knowledge of Payments and Cash Products and Industry ChangeBackground in introducing core banking platforms and associated capabilities highly desirablePrevious experience working large scale, complex change initiativesExperience with working with Agile delivery methods, specifically Scaled Agile.Excellent problem solving and analytical skillsEffective communication skills, written and verbal.Exposure and understanding of Project & Product Change methodologiesKnowledge of NT\'s current Cash Architecture and associated business processes is desirable but not essential.Ability to multi-task and prioritise day-to-day work staying within broader business deliverables expectations. Working with Us: As a Northern Trust partner, greater achievements await. You will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture in an organization where financial strength and stability is an asset that emboldens us to explore new ideas.Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company committed to assisting the communities we serve! Join a workplace with a greater purpose.We\'d love to learn more about how your interests and experience could be a fit with one of the world\'s most admired and sustainable companies! Build your career with us and apply today. #MadeForGreaterReasonable accommodationNorthern Trust is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email our HR Service Center at MyHRHelp@ntrs.com .We hope you\'re excited about the role and the opportunity to work with us. We value an inclusive workplace and understand flexibility means different things to different people.Apply today and talk to us about your flexible working requirements and together we can achieve greater.\n

title: Product Manager
description: \n          Introducing Masabi // At Masabi, we\xe2\x80\x99re driving the fare payment revolution, powering the journeys of millions all over the world. We build fare collection platforms that allow riders to seamlessly buy and present tickets for public transport either on their mobile phones, from a ticket machine, or even by tapping their bank card to travel.Our Justride platform is used in over 250 locations globally, including some of the largest cities in the world. With our industry-first mobile ticketing SDK, we\xe2\x80\x99ve partnered with large players in the transport space, including Uber, Moovit and Transit.Your own journey is important to us too. Choosing a role here means joining a network of innovators from all walks of life; a group of passionate individuals who consistently deliver. Here, you\xe2\x80\x99ll find the tools you need to build the career you want. Whether you\xe2\x80\x99re taking the direct route or trying a new path, we\xe2\x80\x99ll support you no matter what.The Role// Join Masabi as our Product Operations Manager to boost efficiency and foster collaboration between Product and Engineering teams, integrating these efforts with our Customer Deployment initiatives. In this critical role, you\'ll set up our teams for success by ensuring robust planning, delivery, and risk management processes are in place. Additionally, you\'ll coordinate with customer-facing teams to manage dependencies for successful customer deployments, directly impacting our collective success and streamlining delivery across the organization.Location// This position is available as a hybrid or fully remote role for candidates in the UK, and fully remote for candidates in Europe or the East Coast of North America.ResponsibilitiesRoadmap Planning & Lifecycle Management: Spearhead planning across the product portfolio, aligning resources and investments with business goals. Product Governance & Portfolio Oversight: Lead governance processes and report on delivery status, managing priorities and financial oversight. Cross-functional Collaboration: Enhance collaboration across teams for seamless end-to-end delivery. Team Empowerment & Process Optimization: Provide tools and processes for teams to excel, continuously refining delivery processes. Tools, Standards, and Quality Enhancement: Establish effective delivery tools and standards, including lifecycle management and advocating for high quality across the product portfolio. Performance Metrics: Define and monitor key performance indicators to ensure data-driven decision-making and risk management. About YouExperience leading and governing complex work portfolios, with proficiency in both Agile and Waterfall methodologies. Financially conversant, with the ability to understand, assess, and report on the implications of delivery changes on revenue and business health. Strong background in B2B SaaS platforms, with experience in transit, fare collection, or payments sectors as a bonus. Skilled in change management and communication, ensuring organizational alignment with project goals. Adept at managing delivery tensions among senior stakeholders and partners, with a strong focus on product analytics and data-driven decision-making. Familiar with the product development tech stack and committed to applying best practices in product operations for enhanced efficiency and scalability. // Careers at Masabi are for people who are going places - people who are moved by our mission to improve accessibility and make fares fair for everyone. We are grateful to be a network of innovators from all walks of life; a group of passionate individuals who consistently deliver. We operate with openness \xe2\x80\x94 we celebrate multiple approaches and points of view and strive to create an environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their whole, authentic selves to work.Whoever You Are, Just Be Yourself.We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply; we don\xe2\x80\x99t discriminate. Also, please notify our team of your pronouns at any point in your application. We believe in journeys made simple. Excursions made effortless. So, we cancel out confusion and leverage our collective expertise to support transit agencies and make life better for millions of riders \xe2\x80\x94 together, we are creating a future.We\xe2\x80\x99re already powering journeys - are you ready to join us?\n

title: Product Manager
description: \n          About UsAt Siena we are revolutionizing the customer service industry with the world\'s first autonomous AI customer service agents. We are a remote-first startup that\'s passionate about enabling machines to engage in delightful and empathic conversations. Siena is the first of its kind, designed to work out-of-the-box to interact with customers across all channels from a single platform.If you\'re excited about AI and the intersection of human-to-machine communications, and want to be part of a team who is driving innovation and making a real impact, then come join us in pushing the boundaries of AI and CX.Some of our valuesCustomer First: It\'s not just about solving issues or closing deals. We\'re in the business of understanding our customers so well that we can anticipate their needs and blow their minds. Straight Talk: Communication isn\'t just a checkbox for us\xe2\x80\x94it\'s our operating system. We say what we mean, mean what we say, and have no hidden agendas or sugar-coating.. Question & Disrupt: We do things that have never been done before\xe2\x80\x94not for the sake of being different but for being radically better. Act with Agency: We don\'t wait for permission or perfect conditions. We evaluate the situation, make our best call, and go for it. Raise the Bar: We\'re not just meeting standards, we\'re aiming for setting them. Fast & Fearless: We move quickly but thoughtfully, and view mistakes and failures as stepping stones, not setbacks. Driven by Curiosity, Fueled by Growth: We ask the questions no one else is asking, dive deep, and come out the other side better for it. Synergy Over Solo: We value collaboration over individual achievement. When we work together, we\'re unstoppable. We\'re not just co-workers; we\'re co-creators. RoleAs the first Product Manager at Siena, you will be pivotal in guiding our AI customer service products from conception to launch. Here\xe2\x80\x99s what you\xe2\x80\x99ll do:Own the lifecycle of product initiatives from inception to launch. Tackle unsolved AI product and engineering problems, such as enhancing user experiences for complex AI agents and achieving instant retrieval over large-scale datasets. Gather feedback from customers to inform and direct product development. Define new business models, pricing packages, and set new commercial standards in the AI industry. Work closely with our founders, executives, and Customer Success teams to align product vision with company strategy. Learn and apply LLM expertise in complex knowledge work scenarios. Contribute to the growth of our product and engineering organization, shaping the team for future challenges. Disrupt multiple trillion-dollar industries. Qualifications3+ years of experience in product management and/or software engineering. Experience with or knowledge of AI and LLMs. Ability to navigate extreme ambiguity to deliver on outcomes. Desire to do whatever it takes to make the team successful \xe2\x80\x94 whether that\xe2\x80\x99s doing support, testing new algorithm changes, or cleaning up tickets. Track record in shipping world-class enterprise software products. Have a deep understanding of customer needs and the ability to translate these into product features. Have outstanding communication and leadership skills, capable of articulating complex concepts to a diverse range of stakeholders. BonusYour experience in venture-backed startup environment, ideally from an early stage to a significant growth phase. Proven success in working with remote teams, demonstrating effective collaboration and communication in a distributed setting. Benefits\xf0\x9f\x8f\xa0 The flexibility to work from anywhere. Even if it\'s just from the comfort of your own bed (because let\'s face it, who doesn\'t love a good WFH situation?)\xf0\x9f\x8c\x9e Flexible working hours. Because who said you can\'t design your day on your terms?\xf0\x9f\x92\xb8 Competitive salary and stock options. We offer highly competitive salaries and equity, because we\'re building this together.\xf0\x9f\x8c\xb4 Unlimited PTO. With unlimited paid time off and a minimum of 15 days off per year, you\'ll have plenty of time to explore the world (or just your couch).\xf0\x9f\x93\x96 Growth stipend. An annual budget to continue learning and expanding your horizons. It\'s like getting a raise without having to ask for it. We invest in you, so you can continue to invest in yourself.At Siena, we\xe2\x80\x99re not just looking for people who can do a job. We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for people who want to break boundaries, create the future, and reshape industries. If that\xe2\x80\x99s you, we look forward to your application.Siena provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.\n

title: Product Manager, Customer Management VP
description: \n          CryptioCryptio is an enterprise-grade crypto back-office platform. Our software helps financial institutions, corporates and crypto-native companies navigate the fragmented digital-asset landscape with confidence. We are a Series-A company, backed by tier-1 crypto and non crypto investors: Point Nine, BlueYard, Tim Draper, Alven, Aave, Consensys, Outlier Ventures. Some of our clients include top crypto companies like Uniswap or Metamask as well as banks and governments.We\'re tackling one of the biggest challenges in crypto right now - building the infrastructure to help institutional adoption. And we\'re playing to win.What do we care about? Cryptio\xe2\x80\x99s life mission is to be the market leader in the digital asset accounting space. What does onboarding look like at Cryptio?Traditionally - onboarding is a term used to identify a self-serve customer journey. We are an enterprise SaaS company and at the heart of onboarding involves helping provide our customer teams and customers the best experience from pre-sales up to the point the customer\xe2\x80\x99s workspace is set up and they are well on their way. On-boarding is part set up, part training and largely ensuring data quality and accuracy. This role will be solely responsible to improve those areas, tackling the biggest area first. What is customer upsell?We treat our customers as key partners to our business and we hope our customers think the same of us. Upsell involves understanding each customer\xe2\x80\x99s workflow and being able to help and enhance the jobs they are doing using the cryptio toolset. Initially the focus area of this role is largely going to be on customer onboarding after which upselling will be a larger part of the focusWhat do you need to be successful in this role?Be responsible and take ownership of improving the onboarding experience: in an effort to reduce the time taken for customers to be on-boarded. Everything from research, low-fi design, validation, stakeholder alignment, bug fixing\xe2\x80\xa6whatever it takes. Unblock any issues and re-work tickets as needed based on the sprint velocity: doing whatever is needed to ensure the engineering team is operating at optimal capacity. Have a solid understanding of the different layers of data products including how they operate. Be the main point of contact for key customer projects both internally and externally liaising directly with customersDon\xe2\x80\x99t just guide but be hands-on to not only help but also to ensure you understand the customer workflows and the customer experienceShow high levels of empathy both internally and to our clients, setting the standard for what we should expect from an enterprise onboardingBe able to communicate comfortably and with authority to C-level stakeholdersWork with the internal stakeholders and clients to ensure the right tickets are prioritisedEnsure that the scrum team fully understands the context and what is required to be achieved from the tickets in a sprintShape the broader product strategy by sharing insights from your work. Have a background in delivering complex finance products with in-depth workflowsBe data-driven and always look to both improve what you are doing but also be humble on what is working and what is not. What do we need from our senior product manager?Bring structure even when there is multiple moving things happeningBe able to plan and forecast and have excellent communicate to key stakeholdersExperience working in \xe2\x80\x9cbusy\xe2\x80\x9d / \xe2\x80\x9chigh growth\xe2\x80\x9d environments \xe2\x86\x92 if you think of the product engineering team as a kitchen we are after a good ma\xc3\xaetre to manage the front of houseWorked in a small high growth startup before \xe2\x86\x92 Essentially that will hopefully mean you know how to collaborate with team members (Product, Engineering, Customers)English & French language skills. Whilst most of our business communication is in English \xe2\x86\x92 Our product managers & tech team are based in France so being able to speak French will help us ship products faster. So, what\xe2\x80\x99s in it for you?You will play a leading role in helping unlock strategic projects and communicating what is happening to our customers and internal teams. Work 1:1 with the core team to get stuff done \xe2\x86\x92 Cut through any red tape you may have experienced in other placesA company focussed on value above all else: We know what we need to do (KPI\xe2\x80\x99s, goals, the lot). Like all early stage startup we may not always know how to get somewhere but we have been able to attract and retain the right people to help us find our way. If you want to go fully remote to get your work done \xe2\x86\x92 that\'s something a few folks have done, we find whatever works best to get your job done works for us, timezone and social meetups in our base countries are the discussion points we would have with you as we think these are important points to consider. 25 days paid holiday (plus bank holidays) and flexible working when you need it so you can get your best work done. (The above benefits are on top of your salary, & other benefits)What happens after I apply? 45 min interview with Nik on profile, experience and fitOn-boarding take-home task followed by 1 1/2 hour walk through session with the core teamLeadership interview with Nik\n

title: Growth Product Manager
description: \n          Who We AreWe\xe2\x80\x99re doxy.me (doc-see-me), the world\'s most loved telemedicine solution, and we\'re on a mission to connect the world to the future of healthcare.We believe that cost and complexity should NEVER be a barrier to telemedicine. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we have designed our platform to be simple and accessible. Since 2013, we\xe2\x80\x99ve grown to more than 1 million users from 180+ countries and have clocked over 7 billion minutes of telemedicine sessions to date.Our goal is to deliver a world-class healthcare experience to every patient and healthcare professional on earth. You can help us get there by joining our team of innovators, dreamers, and doers.We\xe2\x80\x99re a remote-first company with regional hubs for in-person collaboration (Austin, TX, Boston, MA, Charleston, SC, Salt Lake City, UT & London, UK).Who You AreWe\xe2\x80\x99re seeking a Senior Product Manager who thrives in an environment that offers challenging problems to solve, can drive product projects from concept to launch and brings high standards to developing product requirements that are informed by a combination of research, data and product intuition.What You\'ll DoWork autonomously and be able to take ownership of product prioritization decisionsIdentify, define, build, launch, and iterate on features that add value for our customersBe detail-driven and have excellent problem-solving abilitiesWork closely with product managers, designers, engineers, and other stakeholders to take product ideas from concept to launchTranslate a larger strategic vision into a concrete, prioritized plan that can be executed to deliver an MVP and iterative improvementsApply a combination of qualitative and quantitative research, customer understanding, and product intuition to inform decisions and prioritizationFacilitate clear communication and collaboration across all teams and stakeholdersYour Skills And QualificationsYou\'ve delivered multiple products end-to-endComfortable with ambiguity and breaking down complex problemsCapable of synthesizing unstructured data and inputs to inform prioritization decisionsExperience conducting interviews with customers to uncover product opportunitiesYou drive to understand underlying problems, test assumptions and iterate on solutionsStrong written and in-person communication skills; comfortable presenting in large groupsDiligent with documenting and building shared understanding with all team membersTakes initiative to drive projects forward within a fast-paced environmentExperience with managing large cross-functional projects with technical depthWhat We Can Offer YouWe are committed to giving you the tools you need to do your best work. We will take care of the little things so you can do what you do best without having to worry about all of that other stuff. Here is a taste of what you can expect:A fun, flexible work environment (work from home or on location at one of our regional hubs)Competitive SalaryPaid trainings and certificationsAdvancement opportunities in a growing company, Medical, Vision, and Dental insurance401k/pension contribution matchUnlimited PTOOur employees give us a 4.6 on Glassdoor. Interview Process1st Stage - Screen with our internal recruiter2nd Stage - Video call with our Head of Product 3rd Stage - Meet the Team4th Stage - Leadership InterviewAdditional InformationDoxy.me tech stackFrontend: React, TypeScript, Playwright, WebRTC, Next.js, Nx.devBackend: Nodejs, TypeScript, Jest, NestJS, Nx.devCloud: AWS3rd party: Vonage, Pubnub, Segment, Twilio, StripeOur products:Doxy.me: The simple, free, and secure telemedicine solution currently used by over 1,000,000 doctors worldwide and helping over 350,000 patients/day. dokbot.io: Patient-focused data collection for healthcare. adhere.ly: Providing healthcare practitioners with the tools to ensure patients complete their course of treatment Our team: technologists, academics, researchers, and innovators from all over the world. English is the language used in all internal communication. To ensure HIPAA compliance we perform background checks after extending a job offer\n

title: Senior Product Manager
description: \n          About MarshmallowWe started Marshmallow when we found out how unfair insurance prices are for people who move to the UK. All because the industry hasn\xe2\x80\x99t given this huge cohort of people a second\xe2\x80\x99s thought, and isn\xe2\x80\x99t set up to price them properly.We saw an opportunity to do things differently, so we made it our mission to back the ones who step outside the norm. Since we started, we\xe2\x80\x99ve helped 100,000s of people get a fairer deal on their car insurance. Using technology, we serve people that are often overlooked by financial services companies, solving important problems for people who need it most.We know there are millions of marginalised customers out there. And we know that they face unique problems that most companies aren\xe2\x80\x99t even aware of. We believe that our future is helping these people by learning about their experiences, and building our company around their needs. And there are strong signs that there\xe2\x80\x99s a need for a company like us. Earlier this year we hit profitability, which is a huge milestone, but the most exciting thing is that we\xe2\x80\x99re only just getting started.How We WorkWe\xe2\x80\x99re really proud of the culture we\xe2\x80\x99ve created. We push for progress every day, because we know that we\xe2\x80\x99ll only hit big milestones by taking lots of smaller steps. We\xe2\x80\x99re always open to helping our team mates, sharing our ideas, experience and knowledge to solve problems together. We take risks, think creatively and experiment relentlessly to meet our customer\xe2\x80\x99s needs, and never pass blame when things go wrong. We encourage people at all levels to take ownership of their work, and to be bold in challenging how we do things. Everyone has a voice and the opportunity to make an impact.And autonomy and ownership are only possible with clear direction. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we collaborate to do in-depth planning twice a year, and make sure we leave with clear goals and objectives that flow from top to bottom. To make sure we\xe2\x80\x99re as aligned as possible across functions, most of our work rolls up into four tribes; Acquisition, Retention, Claims and Pricing, Underwriting & Fraud. Each tribe has multiple teams embedded in it, working cross-functionally to do great work.We\xe2\x80\x99re so excited for all of the challenges up ahead, and we need more people to help us tackle them! If life at Marshmallow sounds like it could be for you, explore our culture handbook or read our blog to find out more.The Acquisition TribeOur mission is to make Marshmallow be the go-to insurer for people who move to the UK. We\xe2\x80\x99re here to make purchasing policies with Marshmallow as easy as possible, by delivering unbeatable prices and by building distinctive products.We are looking for a Sr. Product Manager in Acquisition, to own the vision and strategy of the product suite within our tribe. This tribe is responsible for attracting new customers into the business, accounting for 75% of total turnover and growing 40% YOY.What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Be DoingAs a leader of the Growth squad, made up designers, analysts, data scientists and engineers, you are responsible for ensuring roadmaps are setup, refined and optimised to deliver our objectivesObsess over finding ways to continuously improve our onsite conversion. You will create a robust AB testing and optimisation plan to enable rapid iteration and learningPartner the Marketing team to deliver significant growth in the Direct channel, by acquiring & converting traffic through Brand and performance media, Affiliates, Referrals and by building an effective SEO plan. Collaborating to define and deliver a product vision for your area, ensuring alignment to the wider company strategyDefine objectives and metrics for your team and measure how these improve over timeUse qualitative & quantitative data to make product decisions and work alongside research & design to inform decision makingPrioritise work to make sure your team is working on the most impactful projects, mitigating any risks to delivery and resolving prioritisation conflictsWork with your team to build best practice processes, ensuring feature requirements and documentation result in clarity of everyone involvedProactively building and leveraging strong stakeholder relationships, managing expectations of impact/delivery, stakeholder dependencies, comms and expectations early enough to maintain trust and consistency Build a world class customer experience with the clear reward being improved economics for the businessWho You AreCurious - You don\'t stop asking questions until you truly understand a topic. Doing your own research does not scare you and you are resourceful to scale rapidly on different topics. Customer obsessed - You are passionate about designing and building delightful user experiences that get the job done. You are experienced in identifying behavioural insight from qualitative research. You have the ability to balance business and customer needsProblem solver - You have strong business, analytical, and troubleshooting skills. You creatively solve problems by identifying real obstacles and viable solutions. A true collaborator - While we know you will have excellent ideas to put forwards, we value a collaborative approach to reach our goals and as such you should be willing and driven to get your team\'s input, tailoring your communication to technical and / or non-technical audiencesProduct leader - You have the ability to think about the long term vision & strategy while also being detailed when necessary to support the team with executionOutcome oriented - You ruthlessly prioritise against objectives, articulate the desired outcome and work collaboratively to create a path to achieve itEntrepreneurial - You are self-motivated and proactive. You have a high tolerance for ambiguity, ability to perform under pressure to meet deadlines and willingness to take risksWhat We\'re Looking For From You3+ years experience in Product Management teams, delivering rapid growth in SAAS / DTC / Ecommerce businessesHave proven experience in both driving and converting website traffic, with a true understanding of direct response principles. General understanding of traffic driving channels including (but not limited to) SEO, performance marketing, CRM and how to optimise their KPI\xe2\x80\x99s. Bold - You have the confidence, and demonstrable ability, to solve problems using first principles and deep user understanding rather than competitor analysisStructured problem finder - You break-down large problems into bite sized pieces that can be easily understood and tackledStructured problem solver - You have an insatiable appetite to be part of a team that solves the most important problems it findsStrong written & verbal communicator - You feel confident writing plans & vision documents to get stakeholder alignment, alongside verbal communicationIntrinsically motivated - You are motivated to improve as a feature of your characterBonus: experience launching new products, experience starting a company, experience working in both start-ups and more established environmentsPerks of the jobFlexible working - Spend 3 days a week with your team in our new collaborative London office, and own your own working hours. The rest is up to you *If this arrangement doesn\xe2\x80\x99t work, don\xe2\x80\x99t let it hold you back. We\xe2\x80\x99re always open to making reasonable adjustments if this is a barrier to you in any way. Let us know and we\xe2\x80\x99ll talk about our optionsCompetitive bonus scheme - designed to reward and recognise high performance \xf0\x9f\x8c\x9fFlexible benefits budget - \xc2\xa350 per month to spend on a Ben Mastercard meaning you get your own benefits budget to spend on things you want. Whether that\xe2\x80\x99s subscriptions, night classes (puppy yoga, anyone?), the big shop or a forest of houseplants. Pretty much anything goes \xf0\x9f\x92\xb0Mental wellbeing support \xe2\x80\x93 Access therapy and mental health sessions through Oliva \xf0\x9f\x92\x9aLearning and development \xe2\x80\x93 Personal budgets for books and training courses to help you grow in your role. description: \n          The Company  Octopus Legacy is the place to plan for death and find support after loss. Share more than money: leave voice notes, music, recipes. Shape a legacy that connects you while you\'re here. And after you\'re gone. We know the difference a good plan makes, and what it\xe2\x80\x99s like when there isn\xe2\x80\x99t one.  Death can come between us, leaving mess, legal fees, frustration. But it can also make us stronger. We see a world where people talk openly about death, and work out the real meaning of legacy, one that connects to them. We\xe2\x80\x99re here to make that world happen. The Role  We are looking for a mid-weight Product Manager to join our fast-paced and growing team! Work from anywhere in the world for up to 4 weeks per year.An extra holiday day for your birthdayLife insurance, Health insurance, Will & LPAsOctopus share incentive scheme Cycle to Work Scheme and access to the Electric Vehicle (EV) Salary Sacrifice Scheme.Octopus Giving: we match any charitable fundraising that you do up to \xc2\xa3500. title: Product Manager

description: \n          Company DescriptionVisa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. title: Group Product Manager - Scalable Growth
description: \n          We\xe2\x80\x99d all like amazing work to do, and real work-life balance. That\xe2\x80\x99s waiting for you at Sainsbury\xe2\x80\x99s. Think about the scale it takes for us to feed the nation. The level of data, transactions and variety it involves. Then you\xe2\x80\x99ll realise that ours is a modern software engineering environment because it has to be. We\xe2\x80\x99ve made serious investment into a Tech Academy and into setting standards and principles. We iterate, learn, experiment and push ways of working such as Agile, Scrum and XP. So you can look forward to awesome opportunities in everything from AI to reusable tech.Why join usJoining Sainsbury\'s Tech means becoming part of a dynamic and innovative organisation that powers the UK\'s leading multi-channel retailer. As a Senior Product Manager, you will have the opportunity to anticipate and exceed customer needs, shape the product roadmap, and deliver value to support our business strategy. We foster a collaborative and inclusive environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and where you can drive positive change through people and technology. With a strong focus on customer value, agile delivery, and continuous improvement, you will be part of a team that embraces learning, experimentation, and creativity to deliver exceptional results. Join us and be part of a diverse and inclusive culture where your talents will be celebrated and your impact will be felt across the company.What You\'ll DoGet ready to embark on the most thrilling journey of your career! As a Senior Product Manager in Checkouts at Sainsbury\'s, you\'ll be at the forefront of shaping the future of our customer experience and the journey we\'re on to revolutionise our Checkout technology. Driving transformations that redefine how our millions of customers interact with us across the nation.In this role, you\'re a visionary. Collaborating closely with key stakeholders, you\'ll be driving our technology vision, make data driven decisions, and making priority decisions on your roadmap. Working closely with Product Leadership, you\'re the driving force behind innovative features used by millions of customers. Collaborating with multiple teams across Sainsbury\'s to bring different initiatives to life at the Checkout.But that\'s not all. You\'ll dive deep into understanding our customers\' needs and devising strategies that strike the perfect balance between customer satisfaction and commercial success to deliver the Sainsbury\'s strategy. With your knack for creative problem-solving and a passion for experimentation, you\'ll push boundaries, constantly seeking ways to enhance the customer experience.Working in agile teams, you\'ll forge strong relationships with key partners, engineering and stakeholders, collaborating seamlessly to bring your vision to life. Working cross-functionally, influencing roadmaps and spearheading large-scale initiatives that shape the future of Sainsbury\'s.We\'re on a bold mission, and we need someone who\'s equally bold to join us!Who You AreAs a Senior Product Manager for Sainsbury\'s Tech, you are a highly skilled and customer-centric professional dedicated to understanding, anticipating, and exceeding customer needs. With your expertise in translating business and technology strategies into product roadmaps, you prioritise the delivery of value and enable future business agility. Your strong communication and influencing skills allow you to effectively communicate the benefits and long-term vision of the product to various stakeholders. Operating in cross-functional environments, you drive technology-led change, fostering collaboration, learning, and experimentation. Your ability to make informed and timely decisions, as well as your passion for delivering customer value and optimising ways of working, contribute to the success of the product and the achievement of business outcomes.We are committed to being a truly inclusive retailer so you\xe2\x80\x99ll be welcomed whoever you are and wherever you work. Around here, there\xe2\x80\x99s always the chance to try something new \xe2\x80\x94 whether that\xe2\x80\x99s as part of an evolving team or somewhere else across the business - and we take development seriously and promise to support you. We also recognise and celebrate colleagues when they go the extra mile and, where possible, offer flexible working. When you join our team, we\xe2\x80\x99ll also offer you an amazing range of benefits. Here are some of them:\n

title: Product Manager - Digital Payments
description: \n          Are you ready to make an impact at DTCC? Do you want to work on innovative projects, collaborate with a dynamic and supportive team, and receive investment in your professional development? At DTCC, we are at the forefront of innovation in the financial markets. We\'re committed to helping our employees grow and succeed. We believe that you have the skills and drive to make a real impact. We foster a thriving internal community and are committed to creating a workplace that looks like the world that we serve.Pay and Benefits:Competitive compensation, including base pay and annual incentiveComprehensive health and life insurance and well-being benefits, based on locationPension / Retirement benefitsPaid Time Off and Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.DTCC offers a flexible/hybrid model of 3 days onsite and 2 days remote (Onsite Tuesdays, Wednesdays and a third day of your choosing)The impact you will have in this role:Being a member of the Product Management Group the Product Owner is responsible for translating the product vision into squad deliverables to achieve the product strategy, aligned with maximizing value to the client. In addition, the team works closely with the industry\xe2\x80\x99s stake holders in identifying, describing, planning and delivery of these initiatives.Your Primary Responsibilities:Act as Product Owner overseeing an Agile squad and partnering with internal teams for the delivery of new features ensuring that all proposed changes are reviewed, feedback is incorporated and any impact is fully communicated to internal stakeholders.Oversee the review of enhancement requests and defects. Prioritize these requests using Agile methodology concepts and commonly used tools, such as JIRA to document requirements in a clear and consistent manner to agreed standards.Gathers requirements for upcoming change (including regulatory changes) and contribute to service descriptions. Identifies potential risks to achieving project objectives and elevates to appropriate managementBridges the gap between the customer and organization through (but not limited to) representation at external and other relevant subject matter working groups. Gathers / and documents requirements for upcoming change (including regulatory changes) and contributes to service descriptions. Reports back from working groups to keep the product management cohort well informedExpected to be SME in an area of the product and regulatory reporting jurisdiction (EMIR, CFTC, ASIC, MAS, MiFIR), where required, to attend meetings with clients to help with product area of expertise**NOTE: The Primary Responsibilities of this role are not limited to the details above. **Qualifications:Bachelor\'s degree preferred or equivalent experienceTalents Needed For Success:Minimum of 7 years of related experienceExperience in Agile/scrum methodology, including defining a minimal viable product and prioritizing appropriately. Knowledge of financial services operations, in particular the Trade Booking process and Regulatory Trade Reporting, including detailed experience in a BAU or a change role focused on at least one of EMIR, ASIC, MAS, or MiFIR / MiFID II relevant to trade and transaction reportingWe offer top class training and development for you to be an asset in our organization! Please contact us to request accommodation.\n

title: Senior Product Manager, International Expansion
description: \n          \xf0\x9f\x93\x8dUK Hybrid working | \xf0\x9f\x92\xb0 \xc2\xa395,000 - \xc2\xa3120,000 + Benefits | A week in the life of a Product Manager at Monzo | Hear from the team \xe2\x9c\xa8About UsWe\xe2\x80\x99re here to make money work for everyone and we\'re doing things differently. For too long, banking has been obtuse, complex and opaque.We want to change that and build a bank with everyone, for everyone. Our amazing community suggests features, test the app and give us constant feedback so we can build something everyone loves.We\'re focused on solving problems, rather than selling financial products. We want to make the world a better place and change people\'s lives through Monzo.About The International Expansion TeamWe were founded to make money work for everyone! With that in mind, Monzo is expanding internationally! You will help build market-specific products that will shape the future of banking in these regions.As a Senior PM you\xe2\x80\x99ll lead a multi-disciplinary team to set big, ambitious goals for an entire product area, and have the freedom to decide how to meet them. You\xe2\x80\x99ll operate with autonomy and have a massive impact on our customers\xe2\x80\x99 lives and Monzo\xe2\x80\x99s success.What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Work OnLead a cross-functional team to differentiate ourselves and growCollaborate with and influence key stakeholders across the organisation, including the wider product teams, company leadership, finance, marketing, compliance, legal, regulatory affairs and more to get alignment and support for the strategyWork closely with growth and marketing teams to re-position and launch new features in key markets.Balance work to create long-term growth, and work to hit short-term growth targets.Build 0-1 products, features, and GTM strategies for new markets to guarantee customers there have the same wonderful experience as those in the UK!RequirementsYou\xe2\x80\x99ve got 5+ years track record of shipping successful, customer-centric digital products in a fast growing companyYou have experience with global products across different markets, cultures, and languagesZero-to-one experience on a consumer product (ideally a regulated one like financial services, healthcare, or similar)You\'ll have a founder mindset and take ownership of your work!You have worked with Marketing to successfully launch new features.You have the ability to communicate clearly and persuasively to a wide range of audiences, and in a structured wayYou have the urge and resilience to challenge the status quo and make things betterYou can systematically break down and then solve complex problems (for customers and the business)You\xe2\x80\x99re comfortable with numbers, can ground your thinking in analysis, can identify key metrics and their drivers and evaluate the success of your work You\xe2\x80\x99re able to motivate, energise and inspire people towards a common goalYou can work effectively with a diverse range of people and working styles to get stuff done, and are able to thoughtfully and constructively challenge and influence the people you work withYou\xe2\x80\x99re able to quickly build trust and manage disagreementYou\xe2\x80\x99re excited by the ambition of what we\xe2\x80\x99re doing at Monzo and personal finance in generalYou\xe2\x80\x99re a fast learner, humble and curious, and enjoy developing yourself and othersNice to Haves;You have experience preparing products for global expansion by making the design flexible and easy to adjust for different markets.GTM experience Payments & core banking experienceThe Interview ProcessOur interview process involves 3 main stages:Recruiter Call (30 mins) - Once you apply, one of our Recruiters will reach out to you for an introductory conversation.Initial Chat (60 mins) - This will be an introductory conversation with the hiring manager for this role. We would love for you to do a short presentation on a project that you have led, ideally from inception to delivery, involving launching in a new market.Product Loop (2 hours and 45mins) - This stage consists of 3 separate interviews that usually happen across 1-2 days. This will be made up of 1 X Case Study, 1 X Project Walkthrough and a Behavioural interview. If you get through to this stage, your Recruiter will have a 20-minute chat with you beforehand to help you get ready and prepare for this stage.Our average process takes around 3-4 weeks but we will always work around your availability. You will have the chance to speak to our recruitment team at various points during your process but if you do have any specific questions ahead of this please contact us on robertodonoghue@monzo.comOne of our Product Managers has written a detailed blog on their experience through this process, for extra details, hints and tips please see \'My first 3 months at Monzo as a Product Manager\'What\xe2\x80\x99s In It For You\xf0\x9f\x92\xb0 \xc2\xa390k - \xc2\xa3120k \xe2\x9e\x95 plus stock options & benefits\xe2\x9c\x88\xef\xb8\x8f We can help you relocate\xe2\x9c\x85 We can sponsor visas\xf0\x9f\x93\x8dThis role can be based in our London office, but we\'re open to distributed working within the certain EU locations (with ad hoc meetings in London).\xe2\x8f\xb0 We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.\xf0\x9f\x93\x9a Learning budget of \xc2\xa31,000 a year for books, training courses and conferences\xe2\x9e\x95 And much more, see our full list of benefits hereEqual Opportunity StatementWe are actively creating an equitable environment for every Monzonaut to thrive.Diversity and inclusion are a priority for us and we are making sure we have lots of support for all of our people to grow at Monzo. This is integral to our mission of making money work for everyone. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to age, ethnicity, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, or veteran, neurodiversity or disability status.\n

title: Product Owner (Report Hub)
description: \n          London | hybrid working environmentWeavr is the easiest way for businesses, and the safest way for banks, to embed relevant financial services into software at the point of need. Founded by serial entrepreneurs who are leaders in the fields of payments and fintech, we\xe2\x80\x99re a team of 100+ can-do builders who are at the frontier of the embedded-finance industry.The team is characterised by smart, kind and high-performing experts who offer and ask for respect, openness and trust. Weavr is still small enough to feel tight-knit but operates and communicates at the level of a more mature organisation.This role & opportunityWe\'re seeking a dynamic Product leader to spearhead the delivery of our identity, compliance and risk propositions, features, and capabilities within our Embedded Finance offering. As a pivotal member of the Product Management team, you\'ll play a central role in shaping our product strategy and delivering commercially attractive features and capabilities that delight our customers.You will lead a team that is critical to building our compliance advantage and pivotal to delivering great end customer experiences, with accountability for areas such as onboarding, authentication and financial crime prevention.Your role entails synthesising customer needs, setting product outcomes and metrics, defining innovative features, and crafting value propositions. You\'ll lead customer-centric roadmap development and collaborate closely on go-to-market strategies. In product delivery, you\'ll formulate and evaluate solutions aligned with business objectives, leading projects to meet specific needs while ensuring effective communication and management across diverse stakeholder groups.We\xe2\x80\x99re offering a fantastic opportunity to spearhead Embedded Finance initiatives at the forefront of innovation.Responsibilities:Product Strategy:Synthesis and articulation of customer needs;Definition of new products features and capabilities, as well as associated customer value propositions, including pricing analysis and competitive positioning.Define and lead the delivery of customer value, feature and capability roadmaps.Drive go-to-market definition and sales enablement, working closely with Product Marketing and Sales;Product Delivery:Solution options formulation, evaluation and recommendation;Lead delivery projects to meet business and customer needs, prioritising, sequencing and delivering fit-for-purpose solutions.Communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders to achieve required business and customer outcomes;Engage cross functionally to balance customer needs, business priorities and delivery constraints;Contribution to the establishment of Product best practices across the group.About YouThe section below describes our "ideal candidate." However, our hiring process places a strong emphasis on aptitude and passion. If you haven\'t used every specific tool or haven\'t met all the skill and experience criteria listed, please don\'t let that discourage you from applying. We highly value potential and dedication over a rigid checklist of qualifications. However, it\'s important to note that domain experience in Customer Due Diligence (KYB), Authentication, working with regulated infrastructure (e.g. Payments) or Compliance and Risk Operations will be looking upon favourably.Required skills:Critical Analysis: Analysing market trends and competitor strategies enables informed decision-making, keeping Weavr ahead of industry shifts.Problem Solving: Quick and effective resolution of challenges maintains momentum in product development and deployment.Communication and Presentation: Clear communication and compelling presentations align stakeholders and promote support for product initiatives.Influence: The ability to inspire confidence and alignment among teams fosters collaboration and drives innovation.Strategic and Operational Leadership: Balancing long-term vision with day-to-day operations guides product evolution in line with organisational goals.Team Management (Virtual and Remote): Effectively leading dispersed teams ensures collaboration and productivity in remote work environments.People Development: Work with team members to ensure they have the right support and environment to excel and grow.Planning, Coordination & Organisation: Meticulous planning and organisation are essential for successful product launches and updates.What\xe2\x80\x99s in it for youCompetitive salary regularly benchmarked against industry standards.Flexible working environment: hybrid & remote-friendlyPrivate health insuranceCommitment to equal opportunity, diversity & inclusionAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability. We are a diverse and inclusive team, and we actively seek to recruit people with different backgrounds and experiences.More about WeavrSince our establishment in late 2020, our innovative approach has earned significant support, including a US$40 million Series A funding round led by Tiger Global in 2022, along with participation from notable investors such as Mubadala Capital, Latitude, QED Investors, Anthemis, Headline, and Seedcamp. We\'ve also snagged a bunch of industry awards along the way!Join us on our mission to make embedding financial services easy and secure for businesses and banks alike. Together, we\xe2\x80\x99ll create a future where finance is seamlessly woven into the digital fabric of everyday life.\n

title: Product Manager - Growth
description: \n          Role: Product ManagerExpected duration: 7 Months (May extend)Location: London (Hybrid working) 3 days in office & 2 WFHPay rate: \xc2\xa3245 to \xc2\xa3375 per day (PAYE) + Holiday pay (Equivalent to \xc2\xa364,000 - \xc2\xa397,500 per annum)Start: ImmediateJob SummaryOur client is a global tech and logistics leader. Their Worldwide Cross Channel, Cross Category Marketing team is looking for a talented Senior Product Manager - Tech to lead the measurement and operational data/analytics set up for their UK Fleet media channel and expansion scoping for EU. You will work cross-functionally and closely with science, engineering, product, operations, and marketing teams to build best-in-class measurement models and analytics capabilities that help the business understand the efficacy of marketing on UK vans, as well as monitor operational performance and impact.As part of the global media and fixed marketing organisation, the team sits at the intersection of the company\'s biggest brand and retail marketing initiatives. They invest in campaigns that are contextually aware, creatively breakthrough, and measurably effective to strengthen the brand, grow the business, and reduce overall cost.If you are obsessed with dissecting business problems into digestible, technical solutions and enjoy working with technical peers to deliver business impact, this may be the role for you.Key Job ResponsibilitiesCharting the course for the UK Fleet measurement models and operational analytics toolkit, setting the roadmap priorities, defining the feature requirements for what we measure.Partner with your product, operations, engineering, and science teams to translate business needs into a logical measurement design that balances data processing effort, operational excellence, and driving customer insights about which marketing and creative approaches work best.You will apply your learning from the UK set up to scope product expansion to other EU markets.Work with your tech team to create the analytics dashboards and monitoring tools to understand operational efficiency and impact of the program.Work with your cross-functional teams to evolve your ideas and bring them to life, making all the tough trade-offs along the way.A day in the lifeYour Product Management Practices Set a Great Example To Others, Successfully Leading All Stages Of The Product Lifecycle From Concept To Delivery Vision/Strategy: You own the strategic measurement vision and scoping for bringing measurement and analytics tools to life for the UK and scoping product expansion into EU. Roadmap: You define and steward the UK and EU measurement and analytics roadmap, making crisp decisions about what projects move forward and in what priority order. Execution: You love partnering with scientists and engineers to develop new models and analytic capabilities. You own it end-to-end, from ideation to requirements to launch. Technical Skill: You understand the architecture of the systems and technologies behind your measurement products. You are able to influence technical priorities and business strategy through data-driven contributions. Communication: You communicate ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, to all types of audiences.Requirements5+ years of product or program management or product marketing, business development or technology experienceBachelor\'s degreeExperience with feature delivery and trade-offs of a productExperience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definitionExperience with end-to-end product deliveryExperience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a productExperience managing technical products or online servicesExperience in representing and advocating for a variety of critical customers and stakeholders during executive-level prioritisation and planningPreferred QualificationsExperience in using analytical tools, such as Tableau and Quick SightExperience in building and driving adoption of new toolsExperience with concepts such as system architecture, optimisation, system dynamics, system analysis, statistical analysis, reliability analysis, and decision makingExperience with machine learning to support model automation\n

title: Senior Product Manager - Checkouts
description: \n          This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork \xe2\x80\x93 the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. title: Senior Technical Product Manager
description: \n          WANTED \xe2\x80\x93 Innovative... Creative... Motivated... Passionate... BOLD Senior Product Manager ready to drive change... lead... grow with us... challenge themselves... make an impact!With over 20 years industry experience and a portfolio of prominent global clients, IDX elevates brands by providing engaging, intelligent, and strategic end-to-end digital solutions. requirements and are created and managed according to product management best practices.The Main Duties And Responsibilities Of The Role AreReview, challenge and help to produce product strategies and roadmaps for solutions in the portfolio to meet Central regions\xe2\x80\x99 needs.Establish and monitor product health indicators for products within the portfolio, supporting product teams to grow
