title: Senior Product Manager - Onboarding
description: \n          Job DescriptionJoining Busuu means being part of one of the top EdTech companies in the world, a multiple award-winner recognised for its innovation and impact in language learning.Busuu\xe2\x80\x99s vision is to empower people through languages. We are the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest online community for language learning, with 120+ million registered users. We make learning a language easy by combining AI-powered courses with feedback from our global community of native speakers and lesson content designed for real life.Busuu is part of the global Chegg family. Chegg is the leading student-first connected learning platform and a NYSE listed company.What does a \xe2\x80\x98Product Manager - Growth\xe2\x80\x99 do at Busuu?At Busuu, we are highly focussed on driving new revenue opportunities for our company. To help us to reach the dizzy heights we have in mind, we need an exceptional new team member to identify and implement new growth strategies. This individual will need to have in-depth knowledge of growth hacking methodologies to untap hidden potential.A growth mindset: You are highly curious, data-oriented, and obsessed about improving our business performance. Your passion for experimentation within your \xe2\x80\x98growth-product toolbox\xe2\x80\x99 means you\xe2\x80\x99re able to hypothesise and prove how to add value to Busuu. Innovation & Product Initiatives: Discover and launch Growth initiatives within your squad. This means cross-functional collaboration in a fast-paced environment, along with paid acquisition, CRM, SEO, analytics, and other functions. Subject matter expert: Leading early discovery for new opportunities to innovate or optimise for our learners in the growth arena Strategic development: Be able to synthesise, develop and execute to meet our business goals and objectives, while ensuring alignment with the company as a whole. You are highly skilled at prioritisation, and sharing the rationale for the decisions made with the business Data and analytics: Defining and tracking product metrics to achieve your OKRs, as well as using data driven insights to inform product decisions, and identify opportunities Roadmap development: Create and manage a product roadmap, which outlines the products evolution over time, and balancing short term and long term initiatives to improve performance Product lifecycle: Leading on the key product decisions at all stages of the product lifecycle, coordinating messaging and positioning with our internal creative and marketing teams Voice of the customer: Be confident in leading on how best to get to the route problem and depth of problems faced by the learner and the business and to digest and iterate on how best to solve the key problems What we\xe2\x80\x99re looking for in a Product Manager - Growth at Busuu4 years+ of product management experience, with experience of a high growth B2C mobile businessCommunication: You are adept at communicating complex things in simple, and an easy to understand way, and able to adapt across multiple different levels across the business You are highly data centric, you are comfortable self serving and modelling data when needed. Proven growth hacking tactics which have led to significant growth in past companies You are commercially aware, you can understand and explain the business context for decisions. You understand how to use technology to build a competitive advantage in the way we generate and optimise trafficYou care about the customers - our learners and inspire others to care. You love to move fast and learn through rapid testing of ideas. You balance the detail with the big picture, managing multiple levels of communication across Busuu. You are opportunity focused. You see problems and are able to process large amounts of financial data, engagement metrics and industry benchmarks to establish potential paths to success and be able to communicate this within the business. You are open to challenge, and in turn challenging your team; we grow together. You work collaboratively with multiple functions in the squad to build and deliver the squad roadmap for the time ahead. You care a lot about people and collaboration, ensuring your teams are happy, healthy and challenged to encourage their development and long term professional developmentAt Busuu we want to ensure that you have access to some great benefits:Our centrally located offices are well-equipped with free breakfast, plenty of snacks, fresh fruit, and free dinner of your choice if you need to stay lateBusuu offers a great Private Health Insurance schemeThere is a personal training budget just for you, so you can learn more in your field to ensure our employees can continuously grow and progress in their careersWe like to support our teams with their work-life balance so we offer flexible working hours and a hybrid model of workingWe offer enhanced maternity and paternity leaveStaying connected as a team is very important to us, so we have lots of social activities for you to join such a team lunches, socials, quarterly team, and company eventsWhat Happens NextWe aim to have a simple and speedy hiring process and we want to make sure that we are right for you as much as the other way around. The hiring process consists of the following steps:CV application review - We will review it as quickly as possible Let\xe2\x80\x99s chat - Quick chat with our recruiter about your experience and the role A video call - 40-minute call with the hiring manager Test - 60 minute task at home to show off your skillsInterview - 1-2 hour interview to meet the team Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. We pride ourselves on embracing our differences, whether they\'re cultural, racial, religious or otherwise. This means each one of us comes to work knowing that we have a voice \xe2\x80\x93 and a safe, judgement-free zone to speak freely.If you like the sound of that, join us. We\'d love to hear what you have to say.\n

title: Principal Product Manager 1
description: \n          About Northern Trust: Northern Trust, a Fortune 500 company, is a globally recognized, award-winning financial institution that has been in continuous operation since 1889.Northern Trust is proud to provide innovative financial services and guidance to the world\'s most successful individuals, families, and institutions by remaining true to our enduring principles of service, expertise, and integrity. With more than 130 years of financial experience and over 22,000 partners, we serve the world\'s most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.Role/ Department:The Cash Product Manager is the senior leader who delivers cash and liquidity solutions for AS clients and prospects. This position is a London-based product role that will: Demonstrate expertise in NT\'s cash/liquidity products, institutional cash investment strategies, and market trends/conditions Position NT\'s cash solutions and establish governance over deposit rates offered to custody clients worldwide, and Guide NT\'s future cash infrastructure development to underpin future cash/liquidity services which will respond to changing client and market demands.Another Cash Sr. Product Manager position exists in Chicago, and there is a Sr. Financial Analyst in Limerick. These 3 partners will collaborate for consistent global approaches and coverage. This position is in AS Product and works across Business Units.The key responsibilities of the role include: Represent NT\'s Cash/Liquidity products to AS custody clients and prospects, working daily with AS client servicing and sales partners globally. Manage NT\'s custody cash deposit rates, including documentation of competitive intel, tracking of market rate changes, recommendations of rate changes to management, governance/approvals for all decisions, implementation, and communication to all regions. Support NT Risk and Finance in efforts like modeling, forecasting, and compliance reporting. Deliver data according to required timelines and seek management approvals/feedback as required. Coordinate with the other Sr. Product Mgr and Sr. Financial Analyst. Understand regional product differences, local governance/approval steps, and implementation tasks within NT systems. Document best practices for global consistency. Provide global coverage. Collaborate across teams in AS Product Management for new product ideas. Engage in client and prospect conversations with other Product groups, and perform research/data analysis as needed. Contribute to the Cash Program\'s development of technology platforms by articulating AS business needs, recommending approaches that support growth, and support new product capabilities. Operate across Asset Management (NTAM) and the Treasury and Finance teams (NT CFO department). Coordinate with leadership in AS, the Wealth Management Business Unit (including GFO, Banking and Treasury Services (BTS), Legal, Compliance, Riskand Audit. Prepare RFP responses. Track and govern cash/liquidity product usage by current clients. Obtain client feedback to validate and improve product plans. Attend industry events to gather market data and research competitive intel. Deliver management information regarding client deposits/rates within the context of NT relationship profitability.Skills/QualificationThe successful candidate will benefit from having: Previous experience and success in finance, product, banking, accounting, cash management sales, client servicing or another related field of work Understanding of NT\'s current cash and liquidity products. Understanding of institutional cash investment strategies, markets, and regulations. Experience devising and positioning NT solutions to meet the needs of AS clients/prospects. Knowledge of how current cash products are delivered on legacy platforms (including custody, fund accounting and transfer agency). Ability to articulate business priorities for the Cash Program to develop NT\'s future systems. Leadership of efforts that crossed have business units, geographic regions and corporate/enterprise functions to successfully deliver results. Planning, organization, and communication skills as required for presentations to clients, prospects, and NT senior management. Working with Us: As a Northern Trust partner, greater achievements await. You will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture in an organization where financial strength and stability is an asset that emboldens us to explore new ideas.Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company committed to assisting the communities we serve! Join a workplace with a greater purpose.We\'d love to learn more about how your interests and experience could be a fit with one of the world\'s most admired and sustainable companies! Build your career with us and apply today. #MadeForGreaterReasonable accommodationNorthern Trust is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email our HR Service Center at MyHRHelp@ntrs.com .We hope you\'re excited about the role and the opportunity to work with us. We value an inclusive workplace and understand flexibility means different things to different people.Apply today and talk to us about your flexible working requirements and together we can achieve greater.\n

title: Senior Asia Product Manager, 9 Month FTC, London/Hybrid
description: \n          Annual Salary : \xc2\xa355,000 - \xc2\xa360,000 GBP per annum and Benefits applicable by the ClientPurpose of Role: At Client we are committed to ensuring our data and processes are successfully maintained and enhanced to keep our customers moving. We are therefore recruiting for a Data Product Owner to join our new team within the Asset Risk (AR) Division. This role will ensure Asset Risk systems are fit for purpose today and ready for the challenges of the future, providing a bridge between our operational teams and technology department and facilitating better data decision making for our customers. Reporting to the Data Product Manager, you will: \xe2\x80\xa2 Play a vital role in owning and developing the department\xe2\x80\x99s internal systems and processes to ensure they deliver on key business needs.\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure products are developed in-line with Asset Risk\xe2\x80\x99s overall strategy and roadmap and communicate these with both the technical development teams and business stakeholders.\xe2\x80\xa2 Own and coordinate the requirement gathering, development process, testing, training and communication in relation to system maintenance and development.\xe2\x80\xa2 Co-ordinate and collaborate closely with business SMEs (Subject Matter Experts) to ensure products deliver successfully on their need\xe2\x80\x99s; successfully gathering and acting on user feedback and effectively communicating on updates and issues.\xe2\x80\xa2 Become an expert in Asset Risk data systems and processes and provide business knowledge when interacting with internal stakeholders and 3rd parties.\xe2\x80\xa2 Collaborate with key business stakeholders from a variety of teams, including Analytics, Pricing, RV Risk, Insurance Risk and Economic Capital to develop backlog and priorities in-line with business requirements.\xe2\x80\xa2 Proactively investigate and understand issues and pain points with the systems or processes, often delving deep into the data to work out why it happened and how to make it better.\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the Data Specialist to ensure the systems and processes are in-line with the data governance framework and ensure effective management of the data within this area.\xe2\x80\xa2 Champion Asset Risk data products both internally and externally and act as the primary point of contact for product-related queries\xe2\x80\xa2 Support internal and external audit and review requirements to ensure best practice is followed and controls are met across Asset Risk data management tools and processes.\xe2\x80\xa2 Deliver business value through execution of the Asset Risk Data Product Roadmap to ensure the division\xe2\x80\x99s overall goals and vision are met. About you:  The successful candidate will be: \xe2\x80\xa2 Inspired by the prospect of leveraging new technologies and data to provide customer value at Client.\xe2\x80\xa2 Be commercially minded and able to apply analytical approaches to deliver workable solutions in a fast-paced business environment.\xe2\x80\xa2 Comfortable in engaging with multiple stakeholders (technical and non-technical) at all levels of seniority and function.\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence others.\xe2\x80\xa2 Have a good understanding of data technologies, such as databases, data warehouse and data lakes.\xe2\x80\xa2 Highly organised, with a strong attention to detail and multitasking skills.\xe2\x80\xa2 Possess a teamwork-focused mindset and be comfortable with delegation, conflict resolution, and working with different personalities and emotions.\xe2\x80\xa2 Thrives off supporting and helping their colleagues and wider teams and enjoys getting \xe2\x80\x98stuck-in\xe2\x80\x99 and involved in a variety of areas and issues, big or small. Minimum criteria:Essential: \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience of working within a product or project environment.\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience of working in an analytically oriented commercial environment\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience working with multiple stakeholders across different functions or organisations.\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience of coordinating diverse teams and strong task management. Desirable:  \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience working as a Product Owner or comparable role\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience of Agile, Scrum or other project/product management methodologies\xe2\x80\xa2 Background in data analytics, business intelligence, or software development \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience using Confluence, JIRA or other task management and requirement gathering tools or similar About the team: The Data Product team is a new team, within the wider Asset Risk division, with the responsibility for supporting, updating and enhancing the division\xe2\x80\x99s data systems and processes to ensure they continue to deliver value for Client and our customers. The Asset Risk division has responsibility for: \xe2\x80\xa2 Residual Values \xe2\x80\x93 Client \xe2\x80\x99s largest financial risk worth over \xc2\xa39bn\xe2\x80\xa2 Insurance \xe2\x80\x93 unique 3-year cover included in the lease\xe2\x80\xa2 Customer Pricing \xe2\x80\x93 over 250,000 cars leases taken out every year\xe2\x80\xa2 Economic Capital \xe2\x80\x93 capital reserves required to protect Client from unexpected and severe financial shocks\xe2\x80\xa2 Supporting wider business initiatives such as electrification, future charging workstreams, development of emission reduction targets & ESG reportingFollowing on from the successful delivery of the Asset Risk Data Project, which transformed the data management tools and processes we use across the division, we are now looking forward to transition from project to product world. This new Data Product Team will be vital in ensuring we support, enhance and develop these new tools and continue delivering for our customers over the coming years.With our people being our greatest asset, our division has embraced the business\xe2\x80\x99s hybrid working style, with 3 days in the office each week expected.We are committed to continually developing our teams experience, knowledge and skillset, with dedicated time and budget for training and development \xe2\x80\x93 with both individual and team learning actively encouraged.We are heavily engaged with wider business activities such as networking groups and employee forums, while we also host regular social events including an annual offsite.As a disability confident employer, reasonable adjustments will be made available to those who require them and we will proactively support people who have disabilities to succeed in this role.\n

title: Principal Product Manager

title: Principal Product Manager 1
description: \n          Job DescriptionAt Trainline, we place data at the core of what we do. Our vision is to build value creating Data Products, utilising AI and ML technologies to fuel data-driven innovation for growth within our company and throughout the industry. Our Data team is equipped with extensive experience and a broad spectrum of skills, covering areas such as Data Platform management, Data Engineering, Business Intelligence, and Data Science, all crucial for our data enabled value delivery. Our operating model embeds data delivery teams within each strategic theme at the company level. This integration ensures data is central to achieving our objectives and outcomes.As a Principal Data Product Manager within the Global Customer Journey (a pivotal cross-functional strategic initiative), your mission is to drive our data product investments, focusing on elevating the customer experience with smart, personalised solutions. You will harness the latest in AI and ML technology to ensure our customer offerings are not just delightful and frictionless, but also at the forefront of industry innovation as a leader of Trainline\xe2\x80\x99s dedicated AI investment portfolio.In your capacity as Principal Data Product Manager, you will guide our data product portfolio\'s direction, accelerating the performance of our Data Engineering, Business Intelligence, AI, and ML teams. This role is central to forging strategic alliances with business stakeholders, capturing data-driven opportunities to boost value creation, and ensuring delivery prioritization and alignment with available resources.In this role, you will partner with Data Science Lead for your business cross function area to spearhead strategic discussion on our data investment strategy, demonstrating an exceptional ability to set a vision and influence senior stakeholders to buy into the vision. You will advocate for high-priority initiatives, driving a culture of continuous improvement, and applying agile methodologies to maximise the return on our investments.Working closely with the delivery lead for your data delivery team, you will manage significant projects, deeply exploring solution options to maximising customer impact. Together with your team, you\'ll devise and implement detailed plans with clear milestones for monitoring progress and adapting strategies as necessary.In our autonomous environment, as a Principal Data Product Manager, your influence and impact will be substantial. Your leadership will be crucial in pioneering innovations and integrating high-value AI and ML Data Products, thus playing a vital role in our growth strategy, guiding execution, and promoting a culture of continuous learning in data products.QualificationsUniversity degree or equivalent, preferably in a quantitative field (such as economics, mathematics, engineering, finance etc.) Minimum of 7 years in senior roles within data or technical product teams, with a focus on strategy setting, agile methodology, and leading complex, data-driven projects. Proven experience or substantial exposure to AI and ML product development, with a strong passion for using these technologies to drive business growth and innovation. Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to distil complex concepts and influence strategic directions at all levels, including senior management. Extensive experience in evaluating, measuring and communicating data product success and value delivery. Extensive and proven experience using SQL to work with data Excellent Excel skills; good PowerPoint skills Experience of working with modern data platforms and technologies. Experience with data scripting languages (e.g. SQL, Python, R etc.) or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, or Matlab) Additional InformationWhy should you jump on board? We want our people to stretch their minds, abilities, and share their knowledge. Each year we hold The Trainline Tech Summit, which provides Trainliners with an opportunity to stand up and share their story, learnings, or new skills with their colleagues in a safe environment.We\'ve always paid special attention to flexible working as we value a strong work/life balance. The pandemic has taught us that a balance between remote working and being in a collaborative office environment leads to productive teams.Our ValuesThink Big - We\'re building the future of rail Own It - We care about every customer, partner and journey Do Good - We make a positive impact Travel Together - We\'re one team Interested in finding out more about what it\'s like to work at Trainline? Why not check out what our employees say about us on Glassdoor? You can also find out more information by following us on LinkedIn or our \'Life at Trainline\' Instagram account.\n

title: Product & Design Manager
description: \n          About The RoleThe automotive industry is undergoing the biggest transformation it has ever seen as trends such as electrification, connectivity and autonomous vehicles reshape the sector. As the UK\xe2\x80\x99s largest car fleet with c.700k vehicles, it is crucial Motability Operations (MO) continues to evolve and adapt through this period.At MO we are committed to ensuring our data and processes are successfully maintained and enhanced to keep our customers moving. We are therefore recruiting for a Data Product Owner to join our new team within the Asset Risk (AR) Division. This role will ensure Asset Risk systems are fit for purpose today and ready for the challenges of the future, providing a bridge between our operational teams and technology department and facilitating better data decision making for our customers.Reporting To The Data Product Manager, You Will Play a vital role in owning and developing the department\xe2\x80\x99s internal systems and processes to ensure they deliver on key business needs.  Ensure products are developed in-line with Asset Risk\xe2\x80\x99s overall strategy and roadmap and communicate these with both the technical development teams and business stakeholders.  Own and coordinate the requirement gathering, development process, testing, training and communication in relation to system maintenance and development.  Co-ordinate and collaborate closely with business SMEs (Subject Matter Experts) to ensure products deliver successfully on their need\xe2\x80\x99s; successfully gathering and acting on user feedback and effectively communicating on updates and issues.  Become an expert in Asset Risk data systems and processes and provide business knowledge when interacting with internal stakeholders and 3rd parties.  Collaborate with key business stakeholders from a variety of teams, including Analytics, Pricing, RV Risk, Insurance Risk and Economic Capital to develop backlog and priorities in-line with business requirements.  Proactively investigate and understand issues and pain points with the systems or processes, often delving deep into the data to work out why it happened and how to make it better.  Work closely with the Data Specialist to ensure the systems and processes are in-line with the data governance framework and ensure effective management of the data within this area.  Champion Asset Risk data products both internally and externally and act as the primary point of contact for product-related queries  Support internal and external audit and review requirements to ensure best practice is followed and controls are met across Asset Risk data management tools and processes. title: Senior Data Scientist
description: \n          We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a Data ScientistFast, flexible finance empowers small businesses to manage their cash flow better and seize opportunities - making their business and the economy stronger as a whole. At iwoca, we do just that. We help businesses get the funds they need, when they need it, often within minutes. We\xe2\x80\x99ve already made several billion in funding available to over 100,000 businesses since we launched in 2012, and positioned ourselves as a leading Fintech in Europe.Our mission is to finance one million businesses. We\xe2\x80\x99ll get there by continuing to make our finance ever more relevant and accessible to more businesses by combining cutting-edge technology, data science and a 5-star customer service.The role will include Model building:Launching well-designed experiments to collect data. Building causal models to optimise the loan offers we make to customers, based upon the collected data. Deploying these models into production. Working closely with Data Scientists in other teams, such as Credit Risk, Customer Lifetime Value, and New Applications (Signup), to understand model dependencies. Data analytics & deriving insights:Building out our funnel modelling, including expected customer value models at various points in the customer journey. Supporting other team members with analysis of split tests, to help understand the value of UX or product adjustments. Strategy & influence:Identifying hypotheses and opportunities of commercial relevance to test. Communicating data insights to non-technical audiences. Shaping the longer-term vision for using machine learning models within the team. The teamYou\xe2\x80\x99ll join our Offers team. The Offers team is responsible for increasing customer and value conversion from a positive credit assessment, up until the point at which a customer takes an iwoca loan for the first time.The team explores and launches new loan features, such as interest-only periods and longer term lengths. They also optimise other loan features, such as loan pricing and amounts, and figure out the best UX for communicating all of this to the customer on our website.Offers is a full-stack team, consisting of a Team Lead, Software Engineers, and other Data Scientists.Requirements:Essential skills:Strong numerate background, e.g. in Mathematics, Physics, or similar. Background in Probability & Statistics. Experience with Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Scikit-learn, R, Matlab, and/or SQL. Experience using Machine Learning (ML) techniques. Self-starter with ability to work autonomously in an unstructured environment. Bonus skills:Experience with Bayesian analysis. We expect to pay from \xc2\xa350,000-\xc2\xa370,000 for this role. But, we\xe2\x80\x99re open-minded, so definitely include your salary goals with your application. We routinely benchmark salaries against market rates, and regularly remunerate staff for their increasing value to our business.At iwoca, we prioritise a culture of learning, growth, and support, and invest in the professional development of our team members. You\'ll have access to ample opportunities for skill-building, mentorship, and career progression, and can decide your career path, focusing on frontend, branching into full-stack, or developing your skills in project and people leadership.We value thought and skill diversity, and encourage you to explore new areas of interest to help us innovate and improve our products and services.Our friendly and inclusive environment, combined with our flexible work policies, ensures that you\'ll have the perfect balance between work and life, empowering you to thrive both personally and professionally.Our benefits:We put a lot of effort into making iwoca a brilliant place to work:Offices in London, Leeds, and Frankfurt. Events and clubs, like bingo, comedy nights, yoga classes, football\xe2\x80\xa6 Two company retreats a year, we\xe2\x80\x99ve been to France, Italy, Spain and further afield. Plenty of drinks and snacks in our offices. We offer a wide range of benefits:Medical insurance from Vitality, including discounted gym membership. 25 days\xe2\x80\x99 holiday, an extra day off for your birthday and the option to buy or sell an additional 5 days of annual leave. Instant access to emotional and mental health support with our partner, Spill. Share options. Generous maternity and paternity leave. A nursery tax benefit scheme to help you save money. Paid volunteering day to support your chosen charity. Extra leave if you want to travel or study. One-month fully paid sabbatical after 4 years. Cycle-to-work scheme. Electric car scheme. And to make sure we all keep learning, we offer:An L&D budget for everyone, including a book budgetCompany-wide talks with internal and external speakersAccess to learning platforms like Treehouse if you want to learn to codeUseful links:iwoca benefits & policies: coda.io/d/iwoca-benefits-policies-UKInterview welcome pack: coda.io/d/iwoca-interview-welcome-packCompensation Range: \xc2\xa350K - \xc2\xa370K\n

title: Full Stack Python/ React Developer - Up to £100k + Bonus + Package
description: \n          Senior Machine Learning Scientist, LondonRelation Therapeutics OverviewAt Relation Therapeutics we pioneer approaches in large-scale machine learning and high-resolution biology to discover new drugs for patients with diseases of high unmet need.One of the core problems in drug discovery is understanding the biological mechanisms underlying disease. Our team combines single-cell profiling, biobank-scale genetics, experimental functional genomics, and end-to-end machine learning in order to decode and modulate the fundamental causes of ill health. We aim to transform drug discovery and development.At Relation, we are committed to building diverse and inclusive teams. We are an equal opportunities employer and do not discriminate on the grounds of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partner status, gender reassignment, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, disability or age. We strive to create an interdisciplinary workplace that cultivates innovation through collaboration, and we empower each of our team members to do their best work and develop to their highest potential.By joining Relation, you will be part of an exceptionally talented team, you\xe2\x80\x99ll have extraordinary leverage to push the field of drug discovery, and you\xe2\x80\x99ll help us shape our culture and strategic direction. Ultimately, your impact will be felt in patients\xe2\x80\x99 lives.OpportunityJoin our leading-edge machine learning team as a Senior Machine Learning Scientist and play a pivotal role in pioneering machine learning solutions for genetic data interpretation. Our team is at the forefront of developing experimentally validated machine learning methodologies, transforming biobank-scale genetics data (from genotyping arrays to whole genome sequence) into actionable disease risk genes for drug discovery. Leveraging data from external biobanks like the UK Biobank (UKB) and our proprietary Osteomics clinical trial, we\'re unlocking new frontiers in genetics.The critical bottleneck in drug discovery remains poor understanding of the biological mechanisms underlying disease. As a result, we often don\xe2\x80\x99t know why patients become sick and many drug candidates fail in trials while numerous patients with devastating diseases remain untreated. Relation delivers a radically different approach that can better understand the biology of disease and rationally discover new therapeutics.The team you will become part ofAs a Senior Machine Learning Scientist at Relation, you\'ll be an integral part of our interdisciplinary team, collaborating with Data Scientists, Computational Biologists, Machine Learning Engineers, Data Engineers, and experimental scientists. Your role involves driving our strategic priorities in machine learning and contributing to the development of our proprietary technologies. This includes actively participating in the design and execution of cutting-edge machine learning projects, utilising the latest methods, and engineering best practices. Your expertise will span traditional ML methods as well as modern advancements like graph convolutional neural networks, graph attention networks, and transformers. Based at our wet / dry lab and headquarters in central London, you\'ll tackle the unique challenges presented by our large models and vast datasets.In the role, you\'ll leverage your experience from high-performing ML research groups, adhering to our engineering standards and practices. Collaborating with senior group members, you\'ll engage in basic ML research and establish a presence in the external ML community through publications at major conferences (including NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, and AISTATS) and technical blogs. As an established NVIDIA partner and collaborator, we offer access to cutting-edge resources, supporting your efforts to drive innovation and grow.Role ResponsibilitiesEfficiently collaborate in a team of 3-10, delivering projects using the latest ML methods and modern engineering practices. Work closely with bioinformaticians and experimental scientists, translating ML methods for drug development and computational biology. Contribute creative input to ML projects, adhering to Relation\'s AI standards and ways of working. Actively engage in ML research within the broader community, publishing papers at major conferences and contributing to technical blogs. title: Senior Machine Learning Scientist
description: \n          Speechmatics is a cutting-edge, applied AI Research company that is breaking down cultural barriers; harnessing the power of speech. Our modelling pipelines turn millions of hours of audio into one of the world\xe2\x80\x99s most accurate Speech Intelligence platforms. In the coming months, we\xe2\x80\x99re aiming to gather millions more hours of data to grow the capabilities of our APIs. As we grow the number of languages we understand from 50 to over 100 and train our next generation models, we\xe2\x80\x99re looking to revolutionise the way we think about data. To boost this revolution, we\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a talented Data Engineer to join our team.As a Data Engineer, you will own the sourcing of audio and text data for a range of languages and diverse voices. This includes designing, deploying and maintaining much of our data tooling. You will also play a role in our understanding of new languages by working with native speakers to preprocess data and evaluate models. Working collaboratively with our Machine Learning Engineers, you will train speech recognition models and build tools and dashboards to analyse their performance. By sharing your insights with other teams and our external partners, you will drive the growth of Speech Intelligence and our mission to \'Understand Every Voice\'.An average day as a Data Engineer, may look like:Scaling hundreds of data scrapers to collect millions of hours of audio from a variety of web sourcesArchitecting and building new data infrastructure to support preprocessing hundreds of TBs of data across GPUs and thousands of CPUs in a clusterImplementing state-of-the-art data cleaning practices to boost model performanceDesigning and deploying new evaluation tools to measure real-time ASR accuracyCollaborating closely with cross-functional teams to deploy new models through our release pipelines(We aim to get you onboarded and started on something like this in your first few days. You will often be pair programming with another team member on new pipelines, reviewing other folks\xe2\x80\x99 code and brainstorming novel ways to process data at scale with the Accuracy Team)You\'ll Thrive In This Role If YouHave experience developing highly scalable ETL pipelines for preprocessing hundreds of TBs of data, including pipeline monitoring for performance metricsExcel at taking ownership of projects from end-to-end, including data acquisition, ingestion and indexingEnjoy diving deep into results to identify the strengths and weaknesses of modelsKeep up-to-date with the latest developments in data preprocessing techniques for machine learningAre a code optimising guru, building tools to streamline workflows (when off the shelf solutions won\xe2\x80\x99t do)Desired Experience IncludesStrong software engineering skills, e.g. Python, Git, CI/CD pipelines, DockerETL pipeline development for processing large datasets, particularly text or audio (e.g. Prefect, Airflow, Beam)Data stores for large-scale datasets (such as Parquet, key-value databases, SQL) Distributing code across HPC/Spark/Kubernetes clustersBuilding dashboards and instrumentation to monitor pipeline performancePrevious experience with speech or text data in ML/NLP applications including deep learning frameworks like PyTorch; this is a plus but not requiredWhat We Can Offer YouSpeechmatics is a collective team of ambitious, problem solvers and thought-leaders paving the way for inclusion in speech recognition technology \xf0\x9f\x97\xa3\xf0\x9f\x8e\x99.No matter what stage of your career you\'re at - from paid internships and first-job opportunities through to management and senior positions - we\'ll support you with the training and development \xf0\x9f\x8f\x8b\xef\xb8\x8f needed to reach your career aspirations with us. There really is no shortage of opportunities here for you to get involved and collaborate with those around you to deliver your best work \xf0\x9f\x93\x88.When you become part of the Speechmatics Team we work hard to make sure you do your best work with us \xf0\x9f\x92\xaa, while also having a good time doing it \xf0\x9f\x98\x86. With our Focus Fridays you get an undisturbed day of focus \xf0\x9f\xa7\x98\xe2\x80\x8d\xe2\x99\x80\xef\xb8\x8f, offset with Together Tuesdays when we have our team meetings \xf0\x9f\x91\xab.We offer incredibly flexible working \xf0\x9f\xa4\xb8, regular company lunches, and birthday celebrations\xf0\x9f\x8e\x89. But that\'s not all. We\'ve spoken to our teams to find out what they want. From Private Medical \xf0\x9f\x8f\xa5 and Dental \xf0\x9f\xa6\xb7 for you and your family, through to global working opportunities \xf0\x9f\x8c\x8e, a generous holiday allowance \xf0\x9f\x8f\x9d and pension/401K matching \xf0\x9f\xaa\xba, we want to make sure our employees and their families are looked after. Every employee will receive a working from home allowance for tech or home office equipment (on top of your choice of laptop/ Mac, screen and accessories of course) \xf0\x9f\xa7\x91\xe2\x80\x8d\xf0\x9f\x92\xbb!We support people to work wherever they work best. But we also understand the importance of coming together to collaborate, socialise and build relationships. Individuals and teams are free to decide what works for them.Who We AreSpeechmatics is the leading expert in Speech Intelligence, and uses AI and Machine Learning to unlock business value in human speech worldwide \xf0\x9f\x97\xa3\xf0\x9f\x8e\x99. We work with an amazing mix of global companies \xf0\x9f\x8c\x8e, and our technology can integrate into our customers stack irrespective of their industry or use case \xe2\x80\x93 making it the go-to solution to harness useful information from speech. We have recently raised $62 million at Series B and continue to grow positively \xf0\x9f\x8c\xbb.Joining us means working with some of the smartest minds around the world \xf0\x9f\xa4\xaf, focused on cutting-edge projects and deploying the latest techniques to disrupt the market. We believe in putting people first \xf0\x9f\xa5\xb0; we\xe2\x80\x99ll do all we can to help you develop your skills and give you the tools you need to thrive \xf0\x9f\x93\x88. We support people to work wherever they work best and also understand the importance of coming together to collaborate, socialise and build relationships \xf0\x9f\x99\x8c.This is only the beginning; we\xe2\x80\x99re looking for amazing people like you to continue our journey\xe2\x80\xa6 \xf0\x9f\x9a\x80At Speechmatics, our mission is simple: understanding every voice out there. That\'s not just about our tech \xe2\x80\x93 it\'s the heart and soul of who we are.We welcome different experiences, viewpoints, and identities. Our teams thrive in an environment that celebrates and supports everyone \xe2\x80\x93 no matter their gender, identity or expression, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, belief, marital status, national origin, veteran status, pregnancy, or maternity status.But we don\xe2\x80\x99t just open the door to diversity \xe2\x80\x93 we actively welcome it. We\xe2\x80\x99re building a place where every voice not only gets heard but is also respected and valued.For more information on us, please visit our website and follow Speechmatics on our social channels via Twitter,\xe2\x80\xafFacebook,\xe2\x80\xafLinkedIn,\xe2\x80\xafand\xe2\x80\xafYouTube.We rely on legitimate interest as a legal basis for processing personal information under the GDPR for purposes of recruitment and applications for employment.\n

title: Environmental Data Scientist
description: \n          About MarshmallowWe started Marshmallow when we found out how unfair insurance prices are for people who move to the UK. All because the industry hasn\xe2\x80\x99t given this huge cohort of people a second\xe2\x80\x99s thought, and isn\xe2\x80\x99t set up to price them properly.We saw an opportunity to do things differently, so we made it our mission to back the ones who step outside the norm. Since we started, we\xe2\x80\x99ve helped 100,000s of people get a fairer deal on their car insurance. Using technology, we serve people that are often overlooked by financial services companies, solving important problems for people who need it most.We know there are millions of marginalised customers out there. And we know that they face unique problems that most companies aren\xe2\x80\x99t even aware of. We believe that our future is helping these people by learning about their experiences, and building our company around their needs. And there are strong signs that there\xe2\x80\x99s a need for a company like us. Earlier this year we hit profitability, which is a huge milestone, but the most exciting thing is that we\xe2\x80\x99re only just getting started.How We WorkWe\xe2\x80\x99re really proud of the culture we\xe2\x80\x99ve created. We push for progress every day, because we know that we\xe2\x80\x99ll only hit big milestones by taking lots of smaller steps. We\xe2\x80\x99re always open to helping our team mates, sharing our ideas, experience and knowledge to solve problems together. We take risks, think creatively and experiment relentlessly to meet our customer\xe2\x80\x99s needs, and never pass blame when things go wrong. We encourage people at all levels to take ownership of their work, and to be bold in challenging how we do things. Everyone has a voice and the opportunity to make an impact.And autonomy and ownership are only possible with clear direction. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we collaborate to do in-depth planning twice a year, and make sure we leave with clear goals and objectives that flow from top to bottom. To make sure we\xe2\x80\x99re as aligned as possible across functions, most of our work rolls up into four tribes; Acquisition, Retention, Claims and Pricing, Underwriting & Fraud. Each tribe has multiple teams embedded in it, working cross-functionally to do great work.We\xe2\x80\x99re so excited for all of the challenges up ahead, and we need more people to help us tackle them! If life at Marshmallow sounds like it could be for you, explore our culture handbook or read our blog to find out more.Pricing at Marshmallow \xf0\x9f\x8c\x9fThis role will sit in the Pricing Team, reporting into the Retail Pricing Manager. The team\xe2\x80\x99s main focus is maximising broker income, and achieving our growth targets. This means that the Pricing Team is integral to driving the business forwards. But you\xe2\x80\x99ve probably read that all before! So what\xe2\x80\x99s new?We work in a very different way to most pricing teams that you might be familiar with. Everyone in Pricing has the potential to make a massive contribution to the business, so we all take ownership, move fast, innovate and deliver changes to our rates at high frequency.A fantastic aspect of working at Marshmallow is that we have the backing of our senior leadership team to make decisions and take action autonomously. We\xe2\x80\x99re the masters of our own destiny and we aren\xe2\x80\x99t tied down with vast amounts of red tape! We analyse, implement, learn and iterate rate changes before most pricing teams have had their Shreddies. \xf0\x9f\xa5\xa3You\xe2\x80\x99ll also be excited to know that we don\xe2\x80\x99t just churn out GLMs all day. We build & deploy exceptional in-house pricing data science models using the latest modelling techniques. You\xe2\x80\x99ll work alongside other Pricing Data Scientists & Analysts pushing their innovative pricing projects; whilst also being able to work with the wider Data Science community on modelling customer behaviour, fraud & MLENG enhancements. We know first hand what a powerful combination this is!We work alongside a bunch of amazing engineers who ensure we can implement our decisions quickly. We also have access to huge amounts of data. We don\xe2\x80\x99t just mean your standard policy, claims and quote data. Our engineers spend their lives building APIs to third parties so that we know more about our customers than any of our competitors.All of this means that you\xe2\x80\x99ll have access to as much data as you can handle, the freedom to be creative, the backing of senior leaders to make decisions, and the ability to see your ideas implemented rapidly. And on top of all of that, we\xe2\x80\x99re a pretty fun group to hang around with! \xf0\x9f\x8e\x89What you\xe2\x80\x99ll be doing \xf0\x9f\x93\x88Conducting retail price optimisation analysis/modelling using Python. Developing a deep understanding of Marshmallow\xe2\x80\x99s quote, policy and market data and use this to derive insights that can be used to enhance our pricing. Owning one of the strategic initiatives of the pricing team, such as supporting our expansion plans or protecting our renewing customers. Communicating & getting buy-in for your plans to heads of & directors cross functionally. Building and deploying models in APIs for use in real time pricing. Working with other members of pricing to recommend changes and monitor their impact. Identify new sources of external data that enable us to refine our view of the market, and conduct analysis to quantify their value. Working directly with our Engineering & MLENG functions to implement pricing proposals. Providing analytical support in relationships with reinsurers, regulators and other partners. Working within the wider data science community on longer term R&D projects. Providing pricing support for the launch of multiple new products. Potential to manage a small team of pricing analysts & pricing data scientists, overseeing both the technical aspects of their work as well as their career development. Who are you? \xf0\x9f\x92\xa1Proactive: You drive growth by identifying & delivering new opportunities Modeller: You use your DS expertise to build innovative best in class modelsCommercial: You directly use your models as tools to deliver timely real world impactCurious: You aren\xe2\x80\x99t satisfied with \xe2\x80\x98That\xe2\x80\x99s just how it is\xe2\x80\x99; you immediately investigate furtherOwner: You don\xe2\x80\x99t just pull existing levers - you own end to end transformation in your areaOpinionated: You generate your own opinions & pitch to others in an open & honest wayExplainer: You can communicate complicated concepts in a simple way to non-expertsNetworker: You build and maintain strong relationships throughout the businessWhat skills are we looking for from you? \xf0\x9f\xa4\xb9Ability to interrogate data and conduct pricing analysis within SQL & Python/RAbility to combine domain & analytical skills to generate novel pricing proposalsAt least 3 years of experience working in a data driven Commercial role (ideally insurance)Perks of the jobFlexible working - Spend 3 days a week with your team in our new collaborative London office, and own your own working hours. The rest is up to you *If this arrangement doesn\xe2\x80\x99t work, don\xe2\x80\x99t let it hold you back. We\xe2\x80\x99re always open to making reasonable adjustments if this is a barrier to you in any way. Let us know and we\xe2\x80\x99ll talk about our optionsCompetitive bonus scheme - designed to reward and recognise high performance \xf0\x9f\x8c\x9fFlexible benefits budget - \xc2\xa350 per month to spend on a Ben Mastercard meaning you get your own benefits budget to spend on things you want. Whether that\xe2\x80\x99s subscriptions, night classes (puppy yoga, anyone?), the big shop or a forest of houseplants. Pretty much anything goes \xf0\x9f\x92\xb0Mental wellbeing support \xe2\x80\x93 Access therapy and mental health sessions through Oliva \xf0\x9f\x92\x9aLearning and development \xe2\x80\x93 Personal budgets for books and training courses to help you grow in your role. Plus 2 days a year - on us! - to further your skillset \xf0\x9f\xa4\x93Private health care - Enjoy all the benefits Vitality has to offer, including reduced gym memberships and discounts on smartwatches \xf0\x9f\x8f\xa5Medical cash plan - To help you with the costs of dental, optical and physio (plus more!)Tech scheme - Get the latest tech for less \xf0\x9f\x96\xa5Plus all the rest; 33 days holiday (including bank holidays), pension, cycle to work scheme, monthly team socials and company-wide socials every month!Our Process \xf0\x9f\xa4\x9dProcessWe break it up into 4 stages:Initial screening call with a member of the TA teamInitial review of prior experience & introductions with the Retail Pricing Manager (1 hour)A skill-based interview with a principal data scientist (1 hour)A culture interview with a senior stakeholder to check that your work style fits our processes and values (1 hour) We\xe2\x80\x99ll let you know if you\xe2\x80\x99re invited to an interview or not. But, as a small team with a lot of applications to consider, we can\xe2\x80\x99t give personal feedback on each application. Everyone belongs at MarshmallowAt Marshmallow, we want to hire people from all walks of life with the passion and skills needed to help us achieve our company mission. To do that, we\'re committed to hiring without judgement, prejudice or bias.We encourage everyone to apply for our open roles. Gender identity, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age or background does not affect how we process job applications.We\'re working hard to build an inclusive culture that empowers our people to do their best work, have fun and feel that they belong.\n

title: Environmental Data Scientist
description: \n          Senior Data Scientist, Computational biology,LondonRelation Therapeutics OverviewAt Relation Therapeutics, we pioneer approaches in large-scale machine learning and high-resolution biology to discover new drugs for patients with diseases of high unmet need.One of the core problems in drug discovery is understanding the biological mechanisms underlying disease. Our team combines single-cell profiling, biobank-scale genetics, experimental functional genomics, and end-to-end machine learning to decode and modulate the fundamental causes of ill health. We aim to transform drug discovery and development.At Relation, we are committed to building diverse and inclusive teams. We are an equal opportunities employer and do not discriminate on the grounds of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partner status, gender reassignment, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, disability or age. We strive to create an interdisciplinary workplace that cultivates innovation through collaboration, and we empower each of our team members to do their best work and develop to their highest potentialBy joining Relation, you will be part of an exceptionally talented team, have extraordinary leverage to push the field of drug discovery, and help shape our culture and strategic direction. Ultimately, your impact will be felt in patients\' lives.OpportunityJoining Relation Therapeutics as a Senior Data Scientist, Computational biology, you will be an essential member of our multidisciplinary team working closely with machine learning scientists, machine learning engineers, data engineers, and experimental scientists. Your role is pivotal in advancing our strategic priorities in computational biology. Your contributions will be instrumental in charting new frontiers in omics, and working with data from biobanks and clinical trials, including our proprietary Osteomics clinical trial. You will be identifying key data types, statistical methods, and tools, and staying at the forefront of bioinformatics methods for modern omics technologies. Your technical leadership will be crucial in developing our in-house bioinformatics data infrastructure, ensuring that Relation\xe2\x80\x99s platform remains a leader in data-driven drug discovery.Based at our headquarters in central London, you\'ll tackle the unique challenges presented by our scientific approach and demanding data processing pipelines. We offer access to cutting-edge resources, supporting your efforts to drive innovation and grow.Role ResponsibilitiesDesign and implement computational pipelines for the analysis of large-scale biological datasets, including but not limited to genomics, transcriptomics, proteomics, and metabolomics. Develop statistical methods to identify novel drug targets and predict drug responses. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including experimental biologists and machine learning scientists to advance drug discovery projects. Stay abreast of the latest developments in computational biology, machine learning, and bioinformatics to ensure the incorporation of best practices into our research. Contribute to the development and optimization of algorithms for data analysis and visualisation. Participate in the interpretation and reporting of results to stakeholders. Professional QualificationsPhD in computational biology, human genetics, statistics, bioinformatics, computer science, or another quantitative discipline; or equivalent industrial experience. Demonstrable track record of delivering complex data science-driven projects. Proficiency in software development using Python, with upwards of 2 years of industry experience. Experience in at least one of the key domain areas of statistics, human genetics and omics. Familiarity with modern software engineering practices, collaborative tools, and CI/CD. Openness to engaging in machine learning projects and a willingness to develop skills in this area as needed. Desirable Domain KnowledgeRobust understanding of advanced statistical techniques applicable to human biology, particularly in therapeutics development. In-depth knowledge of statistical human genetics with the ability to creatively apply principles in target identification and validation. Competency in statistical programming (e.g. Python, R) sufficient to enable large-scale genomic data analysisExperience working with databases and data types related to target identification and validation, including pathways, phenotypes, ontologies, chemical entities, clinical health records. Expertise in handling broad omics data types, including but not limited to single-cell transcriptomics, human genetics, and epigenetics data. Proficiency in data mining and/or management of large datasets. Personally, you areInclusive leader and team player. Clear communicator. Driven by impact. Humble and hungry to learn. Motivated and curious. Passionate about making a difference in patients\xe2\x80\x99 lives. Join us in this exciting role where you will have a direct impact on advancing our understanding of disease biology, supporting our mission to get transformative medicines to patients. Together, we\'re not just doing research; we\'re setting new standards in drug discovery. The patient is waiting!Relation Therapeutics is a committed equal opportunities employer.\n

Degree within computer science, mathematics, radiology, (medical-) engineering, (imaging-/medical-) physics, statistics, or a related quantitative discipline is preferred.Furthermore, you have/are:Experience in cross-disciplinary development with multi-modal medical imaging (MRI, CT, Ultrasound, PET etc.), advanced analytics/computer vision/AI and imaging biomarkers for translational and clinical applicationsInnovative problem-solving that connects business/development needs to address medical research, drug discovery & clinical trialsSubject matter expert in integrating imaging physics, physiology, and AI model development in several therapy areas (Obesity, Diabetes, CVD, MASH etc.)Strong communication skill and experience with interacting between clinical, engineering & business teamsComfortable navigating uncertainty with a track record for providing both practical and innovative solutions to address unstructured medical/research questionsIdeally, you have hands-on experience with deep learning for computer vision using deep/machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Sklearn, etc., and solid understanding of deep learning theory: CNN, Transformers, RNN, GANs etc. and its various applications like classification, object detection, segmentation.Experience in defining, developing, and validating computer vision algorithms against clinical data, ensuring appropriateness of fit for data science processes is highly preferred.About The DepartmentThe\xe2\x80\xafImaging Analytics department within AI and Analytics department is part of Novo Nordisk\xe2\x80\x99s Data Science division, where we apply sophisticated algorithms and machine learning techniques to some of the hardest problems in the discovery and development of new healthcare solutions. By leveraging a blend of scientific, problem-solving, and quantitative skills, we provide superior data insights that empower Novo Nordisk to further develop and deliver life-changing treatments. Then we want to hear from you.In this role, you will be responsible for overall delivery of often complex projects ensuring their outputs meet their objectives within budget, time, and quality constraints.You will deliver in line with government best practice and HM Land Registry\'s project delivery standards and processes.You will report to a programme manager and will be part of a Portfolio designed to deliver HM Land Registry\'s Strategy.Key Responsibilities As Our Project ManagerHM Land Registry is an essential component of the conveyancing process and of the functioning of the property market generally. Our data is of significant value to digital services in the public and private sectors. HM Land Registry (HMLR) wants to become the world\'s leading land registry for speed, simplicity and an open approach to data.To achieve this HMLR is making significant investment in its transformation. The Transformation Portfolio spans multiple years, investing in a range of products and services, including people, customers, digital and ways of working changes. Delivery of the portfolio is through a combination of waterfall, agile and business as usual change. There are many suppliers involved in delivery and it impacts on thousands of staff and millions of customers. As such it is inherently complex, iterative, risk-driven and wide ranging.You will be accountable and responsible for delivery of a range of projects within HM Land Registry and you will be responsible for the planning, design and governance of the project including obtaining approval for the projectYou will be responsible for managing project delivery against plans, costs and benefits and including dependency management, risk and issues management and resource managementWorking closely with the Programme Manager, Benefits Manager and Benefits Owner you will agree benefits profiles and realisation plansYou will work with the Project Senior Responsible Officer (SRO), Programme Manager and other interested parties on the transition of project products and services to a \'business as usual\' positionYou will also be required to manage third party contributions and stakeholders including communications at project levelWhat We Are Looking For In Our Project ManagerTo be successful in this role you will be able to demonstrate experience and understanding of techniques for planning, monitoring and controlling using project planning tools and methodologiesYou will also have experience of successfully managing project budgets and resource allocation using the appropriate methodologiesYou will be able to demonstrate experience of effectively managing stakeholders and effective collaboration with others including experience of working with suppliers. You will also have the ability to be pragmatic and bring others along with youYou will be able to prioritise multiple demands and tasks and respond quickly to changing circumstances and be able to show effective leadership, interpersonal, communication skills, including leading, participating in, and advising at senior stakeholder groups, such as project boardsWhere an individual taking up the responsibility will be based in Swansea Office, the ability to speak Welsh is desirableBenefits Of Becoming Our Project ManagerWe offer very competitive terms, conditions, and benefits. We provide excellent opportunities for career progression, training, and development. You will have access to a Civil Service pension and benefits arrangements and competitive annual leave.It is a great place to work, where difference is celebrated and we\'re committed to fairness and equality for all, so you feel valued for who you are and what you do. Diversity fuels our innovation. Our shared values help us work together, to benefit the communities we serve. Our employee diversity networks support our culture of inclusion and contribute to our diversity action plan.To continue your application for our Project Manager role, please click \xe2\x80\x98Apply\' now.Apply before: 11:55 pm on Monday 1st April 2024\n

On project completion you will be responsible for project handover, ensuring all information and required documentation is handed over including maintenance support documentation/activity, declaration of conformity, schemes of examination and calibration requirements etc.Throughout the projects you will required to provide weekly reporting to the Programme Manager on all activities capturing key metrics throughout all stages.Knowledge / Skills / AbilitiesWe are seeking an experienced project manager who holds a high level of technical/engineering experience.You will have a proven background in the implementation and delivery of multiple, complex projects.Ideally you will be qualified to at least HNC/HND (or similar) standard within a technical/engineering discipline.Completion of a formal project management qualification/certification.High awareness of Health & Safety such as method statements and risk assessments.You\xe2\x80\x99ll need to be a self-starter with the ability to work under your own initiate with limited supervision.You will be working closely with internal stakeholders, external clients, contracting teams and suppliers, so excellent communication and people management skills are paramount.The ability to evaluate and control cost and make sound financial recommendations to ensure projects are delivered within specified budgets is also crucial.What We OfferWe offer career development opportunities and an attractive remuneration package including:Annual Bonus & Incentive Scheme27 days holiday plus Bank Holidays with the option to buy additional daysPrivate medical and dental insuranceCompany contribution pension schemeLife assurance from your first day with us \xe2\x80\xa6 and many more flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit you!Our Excellence Behaviours: Client-centric, Agile, Collaborative. They help us ensure that BSI is a great place to work and a highly successful business.BSI is conducting face-to-face interviews where appropriate and possible. If you are invited to a face-to-face interview but feel more comfortable with conducting the interview virtually, please speak to a member of our recruitment team.\n

title: Senior Project Manager, Quantitative
description: \n          We offer an opportunity you simply won\xe2\x80\x99t find anywhere else. You\xe2\x80\x99ll also be touching base with our team of in-house analysts and technical support. Outside of Mileway, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be skilled in getting the best from relationships with suppliers and creating best-in-class internal procurement initiatives.Working at MilewayWe offer an opportunity you simply won\xe2\x80\x99t find anywhere else. Only launched in 2019, Mileway has grown into Europe\xe2\x80\x99s leader in last mile logistics real estate, with a 450-plus team across more than twenty offices in 11 countries. Mileway set out to be a different kind of real estate company from the beginning, like our cloud-based IT infrastructure and our team\xe2\x80\x99s ability to flex across borders, combining the best of local knowledge with the pooled expertise of a pan-European business.While we have already achieved a lot \xe2\x80\x93 our international, \xe2\x80\x9ccan do\xe2\x80\x9d team, is only just getting started \xe2\x80\x93 we want to reshape our industry for the better. Our mission is to be the most customer and climate focused last mile real estate company in Europe, creating space for businesses to grow sustainably. To get there, we live our values: Drive, Trust, Grow, Together.At Mileway, we believe company growth comes from supporting the growth of our combined capabilities. This is why we have our own inhouse learning & development programme, where personal, professional and business development go hand in hand - supporting you in your own bespoke career development. While your base will be the London office, we will give you flexibility to work some of the week from home. We\xe2\x80\x99ll also equip you with a state-of-the-art technology package that helps you keep in touch, wherever you are.What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Do Manage a high volume of Development projects. Technical project management, advising on technical CapEx investments. Support local development and CapEx strategies with a focus on permitting, compliance and cost. Keep detailed records of all transactions with suppliers on a project basis. Draft and guide transformations of real estate (redevelopments). Inspect and observe work in progress to ensure that procedures followed, and materials used conformed to project specifications and quality standards. Ensure Health and Safety systems are in place and followed in all Construction Projects. Stay in touch with current and potential tenants (fit-out), map their wishes and requests and handle changes to the leased property. Monitor, elaborate and execute the sustainability plan.Produce reports Ensure accuracy of the project reports and communicate accordingly. Update and communicate the accrual report. Provide reports on actual costs vs. estimate and identify underlying reasons for any variance. Ensure financial information for audits is collated and cost assurance processes are followed.Leadership and Partnership Ensure the team can deliver on the demanding program. Coach and develop the team. Partner with Regional and Centralised teams.Manage outsourced companies in construction. Flexibility to shift from internal to external resources to meet aggressive timelines. Partner with the Head of Construction & Project Management and Senior Manager of Procurement to build vendor relationships. Rate and draft service agreements and contracts.What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Bring Your standout technical track record (+10 years). You can show how you\xe2\x80\x99ve carried urban logistics and industrial development projects from end to end, from pre-development stage through permits, packaging/ tendering, delivery and commercialisation, all the way to the final handover. Your relevant experience on construction sites, covering all phases of planning and execution. Your competence to build successful organisational capability. Outstanding coaching, planning, organisation and communication skills. Your analytical skills. You thrive on challenges, problem solving, and coming up with creative solutions. Your ability to work under pressure in a challenging and proactive environment. You\xe2\x80\x99re a planner, but also hands on. You\xe2\x80\x99re not afraid to jump in and take charge. Your network of trusted construction and project management companies, sub-contractors, suppliers, lawyers and technical consultants. Your excellent negotiation skills. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in a relevant subject minimum. Familiarity with tools like Yardi, Tableau and budget vs actual tools is a plus.Our vision is to be the number one gateway to urban communities. To get there, we live our values: Drive, Trust, Grow, Together.\n

From project inception to commissioning, you\'ll lead the charge in ensuring success every step of the way.An opportunity to work with a growing team that whose values of Integrity & People are at the core of their business.Opportunity for rapid learning & career progression based upon your efforts and successes.A competitive salary & benefits packageLong term projects within the data center sector.Your key responsibilities will include:Offering strategic guidance during project conception.Establishing success criteria for time, cost, and performance parameters.Overseeing quality, safety, health, and environmental considerations.Implementing robust project governance and processes.Orchestrating project planning and resource acquisition.Facilitating collaboration among cross-functional project teams.Monitoring project performance and financials.Ensuring seamless communication between the team and clients.Leading client engagement throughout all project stages.QualificationsBachelor\'s degree5+ years of experience in Construction project management in the UK or Europe, either with a Contractor, Consultancy or Client side organisation.You must be eligible to work in the UK there is no opportunity for Visa Sponsorship.YOU WILL NEED TO HAVE PREVIOUS UK CONSTRUCTION EXPERIENCE TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS ROLETHIS IS NOT AN IT PROJECT MANAGER ROLEApply now and we will look to arrange a conversation to discuss further.\n

title: Project Manager
description: \n          ABOUT US \xe2\x80\x98Engineering excellence through proficiency.\xe2\x80\x99 ReachActive provides specialist engineering services across the power, multi-utility and building services sectors within the UK and Ireland. We are a forward thinking and innovative contractor adept at recognising business opportunity, identifying gaps in the market and delivering total solutions that meet the needs and exceed all expectations of our clients.ReachActive provides its clients with a single source of specialist project resources and services. This approach has led to its five complementary divisions, which provide an unrivalled breadth & depth of engineering services.  DIVISIONS Multi-utility installations and diversionsOverhead power linesSubstationsUnderground power networksBuilding services OUR VISION Our vision is to be the foremost utility engineering and building systems provider in the UK and Ireland. MISSION STATEMENT Through dedication, collaboration, innovation and honest evaluation ReachActive will continue on its path of sustainable progression for the benefit of its staff, clients and the communities in which it operates.  OUR VALUES Safety \xe2\x80\x93 continuous promotion of a safety culture targeting zero harmTeamwork \xe2\x80\x93 collaborating and benefiting from working togetherRespect \xe2\x80\x93 for staff, clients, communities and the environmentIntegrity \xe2\x80\x93 delivering on promisesVision \xe2\x80\x93 being open to all possibilitiesExcellence \xe2\x80\x93 dedicated to high quality in all ReachActive doesROLE PROFILE:Your role will be responsible for supporting the planning and coordination of various London projects within the organisation. You will work closely with the project management team, assisting in the development and implementation of project plans and schedules. With opportunity to learn and grow within the organisation, gaining valuable skills and knowledge in project management. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:Assist in creating and maintaining project schedules using project management tools.Collaborate with project managers to gather project requirements and monitor progress.Assist in identifying and mitigating project risks and issues.Support the tracking and reporting of project progress, ensuring adherence to timelines and milestones.Assist in the coordination of project resources, including personnel equipment and materials and capturing working hours for labour resources.Collaborate with all the project teams to ensure effective communication and collaboration throughout the project lifecycle.Project co-ordination to ensure the achievement of all deliverables in a timely manner, including attendance at site/office meetings where appropriateMonitor and undertake co-ordination of planning and environmental activities, checking of work undertaken, ensuring compliance with company proceduresUpdate and report progress of the project at regular intervals to the Planning Manager.Ensure that the established planning and scheduling approach is followedAssist with the preparation of the weekly / monthly programme report. SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:REQUIREMENTS:Basic knowledge and competent in using Microsoft Project and Microsoft OfficeGood verbal, written communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with project team.Attention to detail and with high level of accuracy in work.Ability to analyse data and generate reports.Good organisational and time management skills, with ability to prioritise and multitask effectively.Ability to work independently and within a teamAbility to take direction from management DESIRED:Planning experience in Multi-utility diversion and ICP Projects will be an added advantage.Knowledge of project management methodologies and best practice is a plus.N.B. It should also be noted that the above list of principal duties is not necessarily a complete statement of duties and should be considered as for guidance only.ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:The role may require you to travel to sites across the UK with occasional overnight stays, as and when required. Due to the nature of our works, there may be a requirement to cover out of hours works e.g., weekends and on some occasion\xe2\x80\x99s nights. Within reason, you must be willing to cover out of hours works, where necessary.\n

title: Project Manager
description: \n          Technical Delivery Manager:PermanentCirca \xc2\xa370,000 + Excellent packageHybrid (Client based in London)Company & Role overview for Technical Delivery Manager:Our client is a global marketing and information services business. We are currently helping them to bring on an experienced Technical Delivery Manager. An ideal candidate for the role would be someone that has had previous experience as a developer, QA or technical manager and has then transitioned through their career into a Delivery Manager, Working with senior stakeholders, product, design, development and data science teams, you will be responsible for building the quarterly roadmap, planning, tracking, delivery and reporting across the complete software delivery lifecycle.You will be technically minded and able to ask the right questions of the teams to get the best possible outcome for the business.As the Technical Delivery Manager, you will be responsible for, but not limited to, the following:Providing written and verbal updates to Executive/ Senior stakeholders.Building the quarterly roadmap.Creating Epics, and tracking the work of the team using Jira to completion.Running daily stand-ups and regular retrospectives with all relevant teams.Key accountabilities for Technical Delivery Manager:Delivery of roadmaps, plans, tracking, reporting and delivery across the complete software delivery lifecycle.Understand the problem domain so can converse with business stakeholders and development teams.Executive/ Senior stakeholder management.Process management and continual improvement of those processes.Managing the end-to-end delivery process.
