title: Digital Sales Account Manager
description: \n          Company Overview:STUDIOCANAL, a 100% affiliate of CANAL+ Group held by Vivendi, is Europe\xe2\x80\x99s leader in production, distribution and international sales of feature films and series, operating in all nine major European markets - France, United Kingdom, Germany, Poland, Spain, Denmark and Benelux - as well as in Australia and New Zealand. It finances and produces around 30 films per year, distributes around 80 films per year. It owns the largest library in Europe and one of the most prestigious libraries in the world, boasting more than 8 000 titles from 60 countries, spanning 100 years of film history. 20 million euros has been invested in the restoration of 750 classic films over the past 5 years. In addition, STUDIOCANAL also produces almost 20 series each year and operates at an international level by globally distributing its scripted productions and CANAL+ Originals (2,000 hours of current and library content in distribution). All productions take place directly through STUDIOCANAL entities or with its award-winning network of 14 production companies in Europe and in the United States (STUDIOCANAL Series, LAILAPS FILMS, RED PRODUCTION COMPANY, URBAN MYTH FILMS, BAMB\xc3\x9a PRODUCCIONES, STUDIOCANAL ORIGINAL, 2e BUREAU, SUNNYMARCH TV, SAM Productions, DINGIE, KINO SWIAT, BIRDIE PICTURES, STRONG FILM & TELEVISION, THE PICTURE COMPANY).STUDIOCANAL is an equal opportunity employer. Beyond our passion for Film and TV, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees without regard to gender, race, religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity. STUDIOCANAL as a whole are invested in ensuring equality and inclusivity for all and offer many opportunities through our D&I Committee and Employee Resource Groups to allow all employees to bring their full selves to work, and to contribute to the company\xe2\x80\x99s ethos and values.Role Overview:Responsible for digital retail commercial sales and account management, supporting Studiocanal senior management in achieving the annual digital sales targets for the UK & Ireland, and developing new revenue opportunities.Key Responsibilities:\xe2\x80\xa2 Fully own external client relationships with allocated Digital Transactional platforms, from avails delivery, marketing, servicing and lifecycle management.\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify and execute promotional strategy for EST/TVOD across new release and catalogue titles, including seasonal/drafting opportunities, and pricing strategies. In collaboration with the physical sales team, develop and maintain annual promotional planner\xe2\x80\xa2 Negotiate and secure marketing placements on digital platforms for all titles with support from the Home Entertainment Marketing team. Optimise premium digital releases, ensuring best possible set-up; manage title life cycle\xe2\x80\xa2 Ownership of administration for agreements with digital EST/TVOD platforms including availability confirmations, price strategies, legal clearances and materials requests.\xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to title and market forecasting, business insights, and be key part of the P&L process.\xe2\x80\xa2 Create title release plans and liaise with marketing team to ensure marketing spend includes digital retail opportunities.\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor and check digital store implementation prior to release and day of release, and around promotional activity, to insure proper execution of release plans and agreements\xe2\x80\xa2 Performing regular title and promotion performance analysis reports liaising with finance team to evaluate digital performance.\xe2\x80\xa2 Build strong relationships with key retail partners. Present release slate and develop strategic plans with partners to optimise Studiocanal title sales.\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and present quarterly retailer plans to track performance versus targets\xe2\x80\xa2 In coordination with senior management, manage terms renegotiations with key digital TVOD and EST platforms.\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordination with Technical Servicing department to ensure all materials are delivered and made available on a timely basis, and in accordance with agreements.\xe2\x80\xa2 Work on system implementation development to allow full end to end avails and price promotion generation.\xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise closely with internal departments and International Digital Team to ensure digital objectives are met and identify opportunities for cross-departmental cooperation in supporting company objectivesEssential Skills:\xe2\x80\xa2 At least 3 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience working within a digital account manager/sales role.\xe2\x80\xa2 Established relationships with Digital clients.\n

title: Division Sales Manager
description: \n          What\'s the role?What an exciting time at Hilti! We have experienced growth and success, introduction of awesome innovation and the recognition of being number 8 in the World\xe2\x80\x99 Best Employer\xe2\x84\xa2 by Great Place to Work\xc2\xae. To support this dynamic growth, we are currently looking for our next generation of Account Managers.The Hilti Account Manager role is highly consultative, proactive and opportunity focused. For us, it\xe2\x80\x99s not about coverage with as many customers as possible, it\xe2\x80\x99s about having meaningful interactions with customers to support their productivity and effectiveness using Hilti\xe2\x80\x99s high-level products, solutions and innovation. The Account Manager role is highly collaborative, you will work closely with teammates and other departments to ensure an optimum level of customer experience with a strategic customer development approach.This role covers the territory of London and the surrounding areas.Who is Hilti?Hilti is where innovation is improving productivity, safety and sustainability in the global construction industry, and beyond. Where strong customer relationships are creating solutions that build a better future. Where there is pride and a sense of belonging across our 120 locations, carrying right into our lives and homes. Where people are exploring possibilities, leveraging their potential, owning their personal development and growing lasting careers. Hilti is very proud to be ranked as the UK\'s 12th best large organisation to work for in the Great Place to Work survey.What does the role involve?As an Account Manager, no two days are the same. You\xe2\x80\x99ll spend most of your time visiting our customers, wherever they\xe2\x80\x99re busy working, to find out how we can help them and demonstrating our Hilti solutions. You will find yourself in different contexts: construction sites, company offices, production plants & much more.At your customers site, you will not only demonstrate some of the most innovative products in the industry, but also market state-of-the-art software solutions such as ON!Track as well as all our services that are part of the Hilti portfolio. You are responsible for the operational and strategic management of your sales area. You plan and organize your day-to-day work independently; therefore you need to be comfortable with building relationships remotely and motivating yourself.The role is all about nurturing and fostering relationships, developing contacts on site with customers and helping them find the most innovative and cost-efficient solutions for their needs. You\xe2\x80\x99ll be part of a supportive, field-based regional team who are only a phone call away.We don\xe2\x80\x99t expect you to be a construction or account management expert. For us, it\xe2\x80\x99s about the right person; the right person is passionate, curious, dedicated and a team player \xe2\x80\x93 our training will cover the rest!We regularly win Great Place to Work awards globally and are very proud to have been placed on the Times Top 100 Best Companies to Work For list in the UK by our employees for the past 10 years.What do we offer?At Hilti, it\xe2\x80\x99s all about teamwork. We have an award-winning culture that is highly diverse and inclusive. We love to celebrate success and as part of the Hilti family you will be proud to work for an industry leading innovator. We promote over 80% of roles internally at Hilti, and as you grow you will be given opportunities to move around the business \xe2\x80\x93 to work abroad, experience different job functions and tackle different markets.Your new role will be rewarding and challenging, and you will be given the support of your leader, your peers and Hilti to ensure you succeed. Within your first 3 months you will have 4 weeks (non-consecutive) training from our state-of-the-art hub in Manchester. This will include training on the Hilti approach, process and product training. The training doesn\xe2\x80\x99t stop there! We have huge amounts of training available to continually grow and develop. Some of our core benefits include:  6% employer pension contributions  Private Health Insurance and Employee Assistance Programme  Company vehicle and fuel card for sales roles  33 days\' holiday (inc. Bank Holidays) plus the ability to purchase 5 days more annually  Paid leave to work on charitable projects  Hilti Benefits Box, a reward platform offering a cycle to work scheme and shopping and lifestyle discounts/cashback  Different ways to work flexibly, including working from home and compressed hours  Employee resource groups focused on gender, mental health, race, disability, LGBTQ+ and sustainability topics  Trips to locations such as Milan, New York and global HQ for high performers across all teams What you need is: Customer-facing/sales experience , gained in any industry;  Curiosity - listening to hear with customers to provide aligned solutions;  Drive - a motivated approach to achieving success & overcoming challenges;  Resilience and adaptability - you are comfortable to walk onto construction sites, roll your sleeves up & meet all levels of customer from managing director to site operator;  Collaborative approach - you work great as part of a team to uncover creative solutions;  More curiosity - you love to learn, develop and grow;  Ambition - whether that\xe2\x80\x99s to excel in your current role or develop into bigger responsibilities;  Values - our corporate culture is our greatest asset - you stand for the values of courage, team spirit, commitment and integrity;  A full, clean, manual UK driving license . Who should apply?We have an excellent mix of people and some of our best account managers joined us with no experience. So, if you\xe2\x80\x99ve never worked in sales or construction, that\xe2\x80\x99s fine with us. Success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background.Click through the \'Apply Now\' button where you will be asked to upload your CV and answer a couple of short questions \xe2\x80\x93 the whole process should take around 90 seconds.If you need any support with your application please contact gbcareers@hilti.com .If we don\'t have a suitable role for you at the moment, we will keep you in our talent pool for the future so your recruitment process might take a bit longer but we\'ll be sure to stay in touch.Hilti is where your best belongs. We are an equal opportunity employer and value the contributions of all our team members regardless of sex, gender identity/expression, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, age, religion or family status.\n

This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone\xe2\x80\x99s race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants\' and employees\' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs.Please take a moment to read this privacy notice carefully, as it describes what personal information London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) (we) may hold about you, what it\xe2\x80\x99s used for, and how it\xe2\x80\x99s obtained, your rights and how to contact us as a data subject.If you are submitting as a Recruitment Agency Partner, it is essential and your responsibility to ensure that candidates applying to LSEG are aware of this privacy notice.\n

title: Head of Sales

title: Account Manager
description: \n          About UsToluna delivers real-time consumer insights at the speed of the on-demand economy. By combining global scale and local expertise with innovative technology and award-winning research design, we help clients explore tomorrow, now.Toluna is the parent company of Metrix Lab, Harris Interactive Europe and KuRunData. Together, we strive to push the field of market research toward a better tomorrow.IntroductionAs Toluna enters its next phase of exciting growth we are looking for a dynamic Account Manager to drive this next chapter in our business. The right candidate will join an already successful team and work in partnership with an Enterprise Account Director to further develop our existing relationship with some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s biggest brands across CPG, Tech, Media, Entertainment & Telco. These clients use the full range of services from DIY platform projects through to more complex full-service research programmes giving this candidate exposure to both the digital & research side of the Toluna business. If you want to get a feel for the type of work we do and the relationships we have with our clients, below is a clip from a recent media event where one of our sales directors was on stage with one of our key media clients:The Future of Media 2023 - Putting the person back into personalisation (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fTwN5XdfNs&list=PL0wzsKy6Z_uYNNIu1U26WhIu5ILkNd0xC&index=20)Toluna\'s value based selling approach means both the solution and the salesperson are the differentiator. Toluna is a business that values how you sell and not just your sales number. If you want to work in a role that focuses on understanding your prospects\' business objectives, not just their research ones, and then building solutions that enable clients to make better decisions using our market leading tech stack, you have found the right place. ResponsibilitiesDeliver and exceed quarterly and annual targets including compiling and monitoring weekly and quarterly forecasts and creating a robust pipeline of opportunities.Develop and maintain a healthy active pipeline of new business opportunities.Conduct effective outreach on a weekly basis, as per the Go To Market strategy set by the business.Uncover prospect challenges that we are able to help them resolve through a value based selling approach.Build relationships at management level and day-to-day buyer level.Ensure all clients are delighted and can promote internally a positive experience of Toluna.Develop relationships that encourage referrals to other departments or divisions.Create bids and proposals that resolve identified prospect needs and articulate the benefits of working with Toluna.Conduct quarterly territory reviews to understand and plan for growth in your clients or prospects.Collaborate with the Enterprise Account Director to create a personalised account-based approach in line with the Go To Market strategy.Develop and maintain an in-depth knowledge of the solutions Toluna offers and Toluna\'s systems.Required Skillset2-5+ years proven successful experience at account executive, account manager or commercial insight role within a research or marketing organisation.The ability to uncover opportunities within a business, problem solve and articulate the benefits of the solution to sell \xe2\x80\x98value\' driven deals.You can articulate strengths and clear benefits when negotiating against our competitors.You understand market research/insight and have had exposure to different areas of market research.You thrive in a fast turn and consultative sales arena, covering a wide range of clients and doing the bidding and full deal cycle yourself with a range of deal sizes and volume.You have excellent attention to detail.You are a strong communicator with great questioning, listening and written skills.You have a strong work ethic and demonstrate exceptional commercial and customer centric execution.You are structured and rigorous in your approach to new business development.You are a positive person with a growth mindset to continuously develop skills and knowledge.You continually identify new prospects with specific roles within net new targeted businesses and sell to them.You create a personalised approach to open doors within targeted prospects and are open to being coached on this. Work in line with the Toluna Employee ValuesIntegrity and respect - We treat our colleagues, clients, and partners how we want to be treated.Success in unity - We deliver results by working as a team with common goals.Smart decisions in action - We implement plans without delay and stay nimble to change on demand.Make it simple - We simplify complexity, making the complex easy to understand.Be bold - We welcome big and small ideas that challenge and inspire us to change.Delight customers - We work tirelessly to exceed expectations, turning satisfaction into delight.Reward great work - We believe performance is the reason for advancement. Do good work and good things come.What we offerAt Toluna you will find an exciting and multicultural place to work. We employ the best and the brightest in our industry and we are always looking for rising stars to join our team. We are proud of our staff members, and we offer competitive salaries, a wide range of benefits including hybrid work from home options and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organization.Competitive fixed salaryAttractive variable component (OTE)PensionWork in an international team full of sales & market research professionalsHave multiple offices in London to work fromThe possibility to work (partially) from home25 Vacation days (+1 for each year you work at Toluna, up to 28)The chance to progress your career within a truly global organization.Toluna is an equal opportunities employer. One small way we\xe2\x80\x99re focused on moving ourselves \xe2\x80\x93 and the world- forward.With +43 million influencers across the globe, we look like you do, like the world does: made up of every ethnicity, social background, sexual orientation, religion, gender, age or ability.Join our global team. We welcome big thinking and reward great work.\n

title: International Agency Sales Director
description: \n          Who We AreThe name ThousandEyes was born from two big ideas: the power to see things not ordinarily possible and the ability to collect insights from a multitude of vantage points. As the world continues its digital transformation and relies more on cloud services and the Internet, the \xe2\x80\x9cnetwork,\xe2\x80\x9d which is now both public and private, has become a black box our customers cannot see or understand.Our Internet and cloud intelligence platform delivers the only collectively powered real-time view of the Internet and private networks, cloud, and SaaS platforms, helping enterprises and service providers identify problems before they impact revenue, damage brand reputation, or halt employee productivity.In August 2020, Cisco Systems completed the acquisition of ThousandEyes, which now forms the ThousandEyes Business Unit within the Cisco Networking Business Group and is the Network Assurance solution for Cisco across the Cisco Networking Cloud and Cisco Security Cloud. ThousandEyes is also a foundational component of Cisco\xe2\x80\x99s growing Full-Stack Observability (\xe2\x80\x9cFSO\xe2\x80\x9d) business.About The RoleAs the Director of Sales for the EMEA region, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and driving the sales strategy and execution for ThousandEyes. This leadership position requires a dynamic and highly motivated individual with a strong ambitious spirit. You will be responsible for leading and cultivating a team of Regional Sales Leaders leading all aspects of Field Sales. This is an outstanding opportunity for an entrepreneurial sales professional who thrives with crafting Go-To-Market (GTM) plans, translating them into actionable strategies, and driving transformative business outcomes. This role reports to the Chief Revenue Officer for ThousandEyes and involves a significant amount of travel within the EMEA region, and occasionally to the United States.What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Do Team Leadership:Build and lead a team of Regional Sales Leaders being responsible for Field Sellers. Cultivate a culture of innovation, excellence, and collaboration within the sales organization, while embracing the culture and rituals of Cisco. Sales Strategy and Execution:Develop and execute comprehensive sales strategies aligned with organizational objectives. Translate Go-To-Market plans into actionable initiatives, ensuring effective implementation. Operational Rigor and Excellence:Implement and apply sales operational processes to ensure efficiency and consistency. Develop a culture of operational cadence, emphasizing accuracy and precision in sales activities. Accurate Sales Forecasting:Lead all aspects of the development and maintenance of accurate sales forecasts. Apply data-driven insights to improve forecasting accuracy and advise strategic decision-making. Business Transformation:Lead initiatives that drive business transformation through innovative sales methodologies. Provide transparency into sales performance, using data for strategic decision-making.Executive Relationship Building:Establish and cultivate executive relationships with key collaborators, customers, and partners. Collaborate cross-functionally to align sales initiatives with overall business goals. Value Proposition and Market Positioning:Promote Cisco\xe2\x80\x99s value proposition for ThousandEyes, increasing mind share and market share. Optimally communicate the unique value our solutions bring to customers and partners. Qualifications Proven Leadership:10+ years of demonstrated success in building and leading successful sales teams across diverse geographical regions. Strategic Problem Solver:Ability to think strategically and translate visions into actionable plans, applying analytical insights to drive decision-making. Customer and Partner Focus:Track record of improving customer and partner impact through sales initiatives. Sales Expertise:Extensive experience in developing and executing successful sales strategies. Innovative Mindset:Entrepreneurial spirit with a passion for driving business transformation. Interpersonal Skills:Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to influence at executive levels.Cisco values the perspectives and skills that emerge from employees with diverse backgrounds. That\'s why Cisco is expanding the boundaries of discovering top talent by not only focusing on candidates with educational degrees and experience but also placing more emphasis on unlocking potential. We believe that everyone has something to offer and that diverse teams are better equipped to solve problems, innovate, and create a positive impact.We encourage you to apply even if you do not believe you meet every single qualification. Not all strong candidates will meet every single qualification. Research shows that people from underrepresented groups are more prone to experiencing imposter syndrome and doubting the strength of their candidacy. We urge you not to prematurely exclude yourself and to apply if you\'re interested in this work.Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.\n

title: Advertising Sales Manager
description: \n          At La Vie, we love meat, but we don\xe2\x80\x99t love its impact on life. We\xe2\x80\x99re on a mission to help people move from an animal-based diet to a plant-based one, whilst keeping a big smile on their face. Our unique product technology and patented vegetal fat recipe, deliver the juiciest meat-like experiences ever known in the category. We are building a movement, a positive change for the industry and the planet.Come and join us.From Plants with Love.La Vie\xe2\x84\xa2What would you be doing?Let\xe2\x80\x99s be honest, La Vie\xe2\x80\x99s plant-based lardons bacon & ham are WAY too delicious to keep to ourselves in France. This is why we need YOU to bring more joy and love to the menus in the UK!Emily, Head of Sales UK, has the following challenges for you:Be the driving force behind La Vie\xe2\x80\x99s success in the Foodservice/OOH channelWork alongside the Head of Sales UK & Head of Foodservice (FR) to develop the channel, in line with the overall UK market strategyTake ownership of existing key accounts within the Foodservice/OOH & gain new business across our portfolio of SKU\xe2\x80\x99sNurture existing business, and work collaboratively with our customers to unlock new opportunities togetherWork cross-functionally & collaboratively with Marketing, Supply, Technical and FinanceLeading and implementing joint business plans with our customers, and sharing key updates with the wider La Vie teamBuild and execute the Customer activation plans in collaboration with the Head of Marketing UK, to make sure La Vie is the most visible brand in the channel!Share best practices with the Head of Sales to boost both food service & retail businessYou are joining our adventure in a crucial phase with many career opportunities: The sky\'s the limit, join our pink rocket ship! \xf0\x9f\x9a\x80Our perfect senior Key Account Manager Foodservice UK :Has minimum 3 years of experience as KAM managing food service/OOH/Wholesale customersHas excellent communication and customer management skillsPossess good financial acumen, and have experience managing JBP\xe2\x80\x99s and terms negotiationsHas the outstanding ability to build strong relationships with big key accounts and RTMs - but is also willing to support smaller accountsThrives in a fast-moving startup environmentIs highly organised and structuredIs passionate about food and plant-based meat!Curious and ready for a new challenge!Is fluent in EnglishThe processYou will have a first video call with HR, a second round with your future manager, Emily, and a business case to complete and present to our sales team based in France: Virginie (Head of sales) & Thomas (Head of Foodservice)You were kicking ass in those rounds AND your former N+1s reconfirmed us what a catch you are? AWESOME!\xe2\x86\x92 Welcome to the final round: a quick chat with Nicolas (CEO & Co-founder) and a meetup with your team in the London office!What makes La Vie unique?\xf0\x9f\x8c\xb1 Impact: We exist to put a happy end to animal-intensive farming. Waking up every day to save pigs and tons of CO2 is pretty darn cool.\xf0\x9f\x9a\x80 Unique adventure: Our vision is to become by 2040 the largest pork brand on Earth\xe2\x80\xa6 Without hurting a fly! We\'ll achieve this vision and tackle all the challenges on the way in what will surely be your craziest professional experience.\xf0\x9f\x92\x99 People: Everyone at La Vie is passionate, smart, and good-vibe. It\'s pretty unique to feel you are only surrounded by people who truly care.\xf0\x9f\x8c\x8e International environment: English-speaking and various nationalities.\xf0\x9f\x91\xa9\xf0\x9f\x8f\xbb\xe2\x80\x8d\xf0\x9f\x94\xac R&D + Innovation: expect to learn a lot and eat a lot of samples!\xf0\x9f\xa4\xa9 Trust: respect and transparency from everyone.\xf0\x9f\x92\xa1Opportunities to learn and Grow: training, learning lunch, regular Q&A sessions with our leadership, honest discussions about our company KPIs, monthly feedback sessions\xe2\x99\xa1 Values that brings us together : #Exemplary #Ambition #Together #Sunny\xf0\x9f\xa5\xb3 Weekly after-work drinks with the team\xf0\x9f\x8f\x83 A healthy mind in a healthy body: Team Participation in sports events!Our offer\xf0\x9f\x92\xb0 A fair & competitive salary package with equity \xf0\x9f\x8f\x9d Holidays: 5 weeks off\xe2\x98\x80\xef\xb8\x8f Yearly Bonus based on our group objectives + Bonus on your achievements \xf0\x9f\x92\xbb IT tools of your choice from BackMarket\xf0\x9f\x92\xbc Office in the heart of London!La Vie is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.If you are passionate about plant-based innovation, have a successful sales track record in the food manufacturing sector, and are ready to make a significant impact in the European market, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity at La Vie.\n

title: Account Manager (Market Research)

description: \n          BRAND MANAGER: KYLIE COSMETICS & SKINCARE We\xe2\x80\x99re Coty, a global leader in beauty. THE BRAND & YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES: Reporting to the Marketing Manager (Kylie & Kim), you will be leading a strategically important celebrity-led health & beauty brand. You will be the guardian for the brand, taking a high profile brand from infancy to category leadership.Kylie is one of the world\xe2\x80\x99s biggest celebrities, with globally leading social media profiles. Loved in the UK for her lifestyle and fashion leadership, while the development of the Health & Beauty brand is still in it\xe2\x80\x99s infancy. But the ambitions and opportunities are significant. Your role will be to unrelentingly lead the development of the Kylie brand in the UK&I, launching and nurturing across multiple categories, showing exemplary brand and commercial leadership.Working with a global brand marketing team and Kylie\xe2\x80\x99s management will require strong collaboration and co-ordination. It\xe2\x80\x99s a highly complex mission to delight all internal and external stakeholders, but strong initial success and an exceptional activation pipeline shows the category leading success you will achieve. UK&I is one of the lead markets for these brands globally, and therefore strong & inspiring communications and dynamic brand management skills are a must.You will have full brand ownership to drive brand planning and the full marketing mix. Cascading effectively to the immediate brand marketing team and cross -functionally to deliver against agreed business objectives of sales, profit and market share. You will have management of a significant marketing budget.You will be intellectually curious to understand the category and brand performance drivers through our many & varied data sources. You will understand data and analysis, converting analysis quickly into actions.To be successful in this role, you will need strong passion and strength in consumer, customer and category understanding to develop creative and innovative solutions to win in the marketplace, managing by objectives to consistently deliver success.You will need to work with and through others, winning the hearts & minds of the cross functional team to create winning strategies and executing every element on-time and in-full. WHAT YOU\xe2\x80\x99LL DO:  Develop and deliver local initiative launch plans in collaboration with internal key stakeholders (e.g. sales team, trade marketing, brand finance) and external partners (e.g. media agency).  Ownership of brand budget, ensuring effective and accurate budget management including administration of all invoices, monthly accruals and budget trackers  Managing of all brand investment, including briefs, agency relationships, global and fashion house approvals and internal alignment, with support from the Marketing Manager.  Local brand management including P&L steering to make sure all brand investments are delivering vs target KPIs and profitability targets.  Working with the internal & international merchandising teams to manage the design and production of local POS elements, ensure they follow both Global guidelines and UK market requirements.  Liaising with internal PR/ Influencer Marketing team to drive consumer engagement and off and online reach.  Work with internal teams on forecasts of all new initiatives and correct phasing in line with our sell-out ambitions.  Driving an online first mentality, finding disruptive ideas that connect with consumers and deliver strong ROI.  Conducting pre and post analysis of launches and promotions \xe2\x80\x93 qualitative and quantitative.  Brand analysis and share reporting on a monthly basis providing insights to relevant team members.  Along with internal cross divisional teams, co-manage the S&OP process, driving insights and actions for the accurate forecast for new and ongoing stock forecasts.  With the support of the Marketing Manager, create and implement the UK brand strategy which includes short-term intervention plans as well as longer term brand vision goals.  Development and delivery of brand presentations to Internal and external stakeholders, including retailers, media owners and internal teams.  Managing and organising potential experiential events for the brand from concept through to creation.  Producing local brand bibles and ensuring all marketing elements are available from the International teams for TM, VM, sales.  Supporting the Marketing Manager with ad hoc requests as required.  Work closely with the Trade Marketing team for value promotional opportunities, sets, bundles and commercial retailer opportunities in line with brand targets and P&Ls.  WHAT YOU\xe2\x80\x99LL BRING:  Degree or equivalent qualification in a Business related degree preferable.  Previous experience in a similar role ideal & an understanding/appreciation of the premium beauty (makeup&skincare) market and retail environment required.  Startup and Entrepreneur mentality who embraces lack of process and sees opportunity to bring structure to mess.  Past experience in budget management and a strong understanding of financials.  Experience working with the Microsoft Office suite with strong working knowledge of PowerPoint and excel.  A passion for the Luxury and Beauty industries.  Analytical mindset; A doer who proactively seeks improvement, is a solution provider and a problem solver.  Organized in action; structured mind.  Organizes own work and the work of others effectively.  Self-Starter; Is passionate, enthusiastic and has fun in work achievement.  Excellence in execution; takes responsibility for the quality of all deliverables, contributes to doing things better and faster.  Leader mentality, owns it, drives it. Sees opportunities to fix/ improve processes, and drives stakeholders to support deliver this change.  Good communication skills, both written and verbal.  Constructive networker; collaborates easily with others and adapts to different working styles.  Change champion; Is resilient and flexible, adapts to new challenges.  Ability to build meaningful relationships and work closely with internal and external stakeholders and wider member of the organization in order to achieve brand objectives.  WHAT WE BRING: Marketing & SalesWe drive growth, brand equity and customer loyalty with innovative products, digital campaigns, events, partnerships and in-store executions. Our work includes both the physical and digital world across all categories. We aim to be gamechangers in the beauty industry, winning the hearts and minds of consumers around the world.\n

title: Social Media Manager
description: \n          OverviewTen\xe2\x80\x99s Global Marketing team is looking for a Membership Sales Manager. The right candidate will be an enthusiastic individual, who is passionate about building relationships and being responsible for the first impression of Ten, whilst achieving sales targets and working with service delivery to ensure exceptional service is being delivered to HNW and UHNW members.They will collaborate with Ten\xe2\x80\x99s most senior Lifestyle Managers, Team Managers and Service Delivery Directors, and gain a list of highly useful and transferable skills within B2C sales, customer service and beyond.This role is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to progress their career in luxury service sales and grow within a global organisation.Who We\xe2\x80\x99re Looking ForA confident, knowledgeable and driven individual that is looking to further develop their sales experience and be involved in the full membership sales cycle, from supporting marketing of the service (including oversight of the Ten Membership site) to building and converting the sales pipeline and managing first year renewals. You\xe2\x80\x99ll be passionate about sharing Ten\xe2\x80\x99s service with the world.A successful track record in sales or customer service roles (previous B2C sales experience is a plus) with the following: Strong communication skills with the ability to build rapport and trust with customers, both verbal and written. Thrive on meeting new people and business networking including attending events and joining luxury community groups Goal-oriented with a strong drive to achieve results and exceed targets. Ability to work independently as well as part of a collaborative team environment. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Canva and CRM software (e.g., HubSpot or Salesforce). Flexible and can adapt to changing priorities according to business needs. Who We AreTen Lifestyle Group is an AIM-listed global travel and lifestyle concierge company founded in 1998 by Alex Cheatle and Andrew Long. Delivering unique travel, entertainment and dining experiences to the world, Ten is a vital part of the customer engagement strategies of leading premium financial services and consumer brands. Today, millions of members have access to Ten\xe2\x80\x99s services across lifestyle, travel, dining, entertainment and retail benefits on behalf of over fifty clients including HSBC, Coutts, Bank of America, Westpac and Royal Bank of Canada.As well as offering a private membership tier, Ten serves some of the most valuable customers of the world\'s leading private banks, premium financial services and luxury brands. Corporate clients use Ten\xe2\x80\x99s services to acquire, engage and retain affluent, high-net-worth customers. The service drives critical customer metrics, including revenue growth and Net Promoter Score, and supports digital transformation initiatives.Ten\'s partnerships are based on multi-year contracts which generate revenue through platform-as-a-service and technology fees. Its operations are underpinned by an increasingly sophisticated personalisation platform comprising industry-first, proprietary technology, thousands of supplier relationships and 25 years of expertise delivered from 22 global offices. All Ten\'s services are made available to clients on either a white-label, co-branded, or affiliate partnership basis.Looking Ahead, Ten\'s Strategy Revolves Around Four Key Areas Deliver a world-class member experienceInvest in technologyExpand contracts with new and existing clientsEstablish a foothold in new markets by leveraging its market-leading service propositionFor more information, please watch Ten\'s Growth Engine Video https://tenlifestylegroup.com/investors/#growth-en...Key ResponsibilitiesThe information below is representative of the work performed in this position; however, it is not all-inclusive. Duties and responsibilities are subject to change based on business needs.Lead Generation and Sales: Proactively find and engage potential HNW and UHNW prospective members to promote Ten personal membership and drive sales revenue. This includes attending networking events and forming relevant referral partnerships with luxury brands and services. Customer Engagement and Retention: Build strong relationships with prospective members through effective communication, active listening, and understanding their needs and support through from initial sale through to their first renewal. Product and Proposition Knowledge: Develop a comprehensive understanding of our service, proposition and effectively communicating its features, benefits, and value to prospective members. Sales Process Management: Manage the entire sales process from prospecting to closing, ensuring a seamless and positive experience for prospective members. Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of customer interactions, sales activities, and progress Target Achievement: Meet or exceed monthly/quarterly sales targets and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) set by Business Development Director. Market Research: Stay updated on industry trends, competitor activities, and market developments to identify new sales opportunities and strategies. Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams such as proposition to find out the latest member benefit to drive sales, marketing to ensure Ten Membership site and social media is supporting sales, whilst liaising with service delivery to keep up to date with member journey and support with renewals. Key Measure of Success The information below is representative of the work performed in this position; however, it is not all-inclusive. Duties and responsibilities are subject to change based on business needs.\xe2\x80\xaf Ten Membership Sales Revenue Retention rates RequirementsKnowledge, Skills & Abilities As a Membership Sales Manager you will be expected to role model Ten\xe2\x80\x99s Standards and the behaviors associated with our values: Member Focused, Trustworthy, and Pioneering. This means approaching your work every day with a positive, solution-oriented, and supportive attitude, and setting ambitious standards for yourself.Along with relevant experience, the Membership Sales Manager is expected to be skilled within the following areas:\xe2\x80\xaf Communication:\xe2\x80\xafstrong communication skills and confidence dealing with HNW/UHNWIs and their lifestyle, expectations, needs and preferences. Collaborative Management:\xe2\x80\xafproficiency in collaborating with various stakeholders, including Head of Personal Service and various stakeholders around the world, fostering a culture of cooperation and shared accountability.\xe2\x80\xaf Sound Decision-Making:\xe2\x80\xafability to make decisions amidst competing demands of HNW and UHNW members, whilst balancing service delivery and proposition offering. Adaptability and Resilience:\xe2\x80\xafflexibility to adapt to changing priorities, resolve conflicts or member satisfaction issues with service delivery. BenefitsOur people are at the heart of the business, and we have a culture of recognition and reward - both through regular appraisals but also annual Extra Mile Awards where we celebrate those who have gone that extra mile in their role. We also encourage all our staff to incorporate their aspirations and interests into their career at Ten and we are there every step of the way in supporting development.All Our Employees Also Enjoy a Range Of BenefitsA competitive salary will be offered depending on experienceOffer flexible work arrangements including Hybrid work possibilitiesAnnual Leave of 25 days per annum and an additional 3 extra days of annual leave in the third yearOne (1) month paid Sabbatical after every 5 years of Service, without tapping into annual leaveEmployer-contributory company pension (with a scheme that allows full decision making about what investments are made, levels of risk, ethical funds etc.)Lucrative Ten Loyalty Rewards programRemote Working Holidays - Travel and Work for up to 4 weeks per year!Access to lots of great travel and entertainment discounts as our clients\xe2\x80\x99 members would!Be part of our global, dynamic, and inclusive Team, with diversity at its core.Possibility of growth within a dynamic and international companyCommitment to DiversityWe encourage diverse philosophies, cultures, and experiences. We appreciate diversity and are dedicated to creating an inclusive work environment for our employees. This idea unites the teams at TEN. All aspects of our relationship, including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or terminate, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs.\xe2\x80\x9cTen works with a small, preferred supplier list of recruitment agencies only. Please note we are not accepting any further recruitment agencies at this time.\xe2\x80\x9d\n

You\xe2\x80\x99ll work in a welcoming and inclusive environment, and get the benefits, flexibility, and support you need to succeed.A lot of people think Marketing is about writing clever words, producing cool images and posting them on a social media feed. You\xe2\x80\x99ll also need to have great attention to detail and a strong bias towards technical solutions, processes and measurement. Because we work a lot with our colleagues in the US, we\xe2\x80\x99d ask that you\xe2\x80\x99d be flexible with your schedule to coordinate with the US west coast teams where needed, too.BenefitsYou will accrue 25 vacation days per year in addition to statutory UK Bank HolidaysOne Celebration Day per calendar yearPrivate Health & Dental and Life InsurancesEmployee Assistance Program (EAP)Pension FundGym DiscountBike2WorkSeason Loan TicketReimbursable eye tests and 100 GBP contribution towards VDU glasses onlyPerkbox & Booking.com business discountsThere are a variety of factors that go into determining a salary range, including but not limited to external market benchmark data, geographic location, and years of experience sought/required. The range for this London, England located role is \xc2\xa335,000-42,000.Diversity, Equity, and InclusionOpenTable aspires to be a workplace that reflects the diverse communities we serve and a culture that is inclusive and welcoming. You\xe2\x80\x99ll work with the goal of delighting our customers at every opportunity.This role is both deeply strategic and extremely hands-on - if you\xe2\x80\x99re the kind of Product Marketer who loves shepherding a feature from roadmap item to revenue-driving success, then this is one for you!\xf0\x9f\xa6\xb8\xe2\x80\x8d\xe2\x99\x80\xef\xb8\x8f What You Will Be DoingDrive positioning and messaging for key Birdie productsOwn the relationship with Product, developing the calendar of product and feature launches and establishing shared goals and strategies in line with overall business objectivesOwning the creation and performance of go-to-market launch strategies, including planning and create content for our product experience, including sales materials, blog content, website updates, and product tours. Be accountable for setting objectives and measuring attainment. Drive the marketing strategies for products and features with the Marketing team, leading in defining key channels, target audiences and budgets, and being accountable for measuring impact. Training commercial (Sales, Customer Success and Customer Support) teams on the Birdie product and new features, its positioning and messaging, including competitive differentiationRequirements\xf0\x9f\xa4\xa9 We\xe2\x80\x99d love to hear from you if\xe2\x80\xa6You have 3+ years of experience in B2B product marketing, ideally in a high growth startup environmentYou are excellent at articulating the essence of products and partnerships and the value they create, and have experience creating positioning strategies and messaging playbooks. You can also play copywriter and know good work when you see it. You are passionate about knowing your market, customers and competition better than anyone, and are confident in how to drive insight programmes. You are an exceptional communicator with strong interpersonal skills to drive and motivate a team with diverse backgrounds and skills, able to hold your own with technical teams as well as SalespeopleYou have a strong understanding of the B2B marketing mix and sales motion, including feeling comfortable using marketing automation tools and CMS systems. You are very autonomous and comfortable operating in a fast-paced environment, but also know when to ask for advice or support from the wider team. These are our ideal requirements, but we know some people are less likely to apply for the role unless they are 100% qualified. We promote a diverse, inclusive and empowering culture at Birdie, so please apply if you meet the majority of these competencies.\xf0\x9f\x99\x8c What are the benefits?People are our core strength. We are social entrepreneurs, boasting an outstanding culture (employer net promotion score of 67) with strong values (B-Corp certified). We offer exceptional benefits and invest massively in our team\'s happiness, wellbeing and growth:\xe2\x9c\xa8 CompensationOur salary packages are competitive, this role is \xc2\xa345,000. We also grant generous stock options to any permanent employee at the end of the probation period. We adjust salaries based on the cost of living index for employees based outside of the UK.\xf0\x9f\x8f\x9d LocationThis role will be based in London. We organise regular in-person events and online socials to make sure you can meet up with peers.Birdie cannot currently support any visa applications, we do require permanent right to work in the role\xe2\x80\x99s location.\xf0\x9f\x8c\xb1 L&D budgetGrowth is key. You\'ll have an annual personal development budget to put towards books, courses, trainings and conferences; continuous coaching within the team and with external experts.\xf0\x9f\x8f\xa1 Work From Home budgetMaking your workspace comfortable is important to us, you\xe2\x80\x99ll have access to a WFH equipment budget to ensure you have what you need.\xf0\x9f\x8c\xb4 Base holiday33 days base holiday (25 days + 8 bank holidays)\xf0\x9f\x8e\x84 Christmas leaveBirdie closes between Christmas and New Year so you can have some down time with your loved ones. This is in addition to your base holiday!\xf0\x9f\x8e\x82 Birthday leaveAn extra day off for your birthday (you can take this whenever you want during the year)\xf0\x9f\xab\xb6\xf0\x9f\x8f\xbb Birdie giving daysBirdie is a B-corp and we care deeply about social impact this means you can take 2 paid days each year for volunteering to a cause you\xe2\x80\x99re passionate about.\xf0\x9f\x8c\x8d SabbaticalsWe recognise that sometimes a longer break is desired, that\xe2\x80\x99s why as of 2024 we have introduced a sabbatical policy. When you have been with us for 4 years you can take up to 3 months off.\xf0\x9f\x91\xa9\xe2\x80\x8d\xe2\x9a\x95\xef\xb8\x8f Private health insuranceComprehensive health insurance with AXA that covers many physical and mental health costs\xe2\x98\x80\xef\xb8\x8f Gym and wellbeing discountsGym discounts and numerous other wellbeing perks via Happl\xf0\x9f\x9a\xb2 Cycle to work schemeBirdie will buy a bike up-front and you can salary sacrifice to pay-off over the next 12-36 months\xf0\x9f\x91\xbc\xf0\x9f\x8f\xbd Parental LeaveHighly favourable parental leave policy; once you have spent twelve consecutive months on our payroll, primary caregivers are entitled to 26 weeks of parental leave at 100% of your usual salary and secondary caregivers are entitled to 12 weeks of parental leave, at 100% of your usual salary.\xf0\x9f\x90\xa3 Fertility Leave Birdie recognises the emotional and physical challenges which may arise during fertility treatments, and supports all Birdies by offering 5 additional paid days of leave.\xf0\x9f\x91\xb5\xf0\x9f\x8f\xbb Employer pension contributionBirdie contributes 4% of your salary to your pension when you contribute 5% (UK Birdies)\xe2\x9b\xb7 Frequent Company Socials, Trips And MealsWe organise many socials, quarterly retreats and annual company-wide retreats\xf0\x9f\xa4\x97 Exceptional cultureWe see ourselves as social entrepreneurs shaping a new kind of organisation: caring, responsible yet fostering excellence. Read The Birdie Way to learn more.\xe2\x9d\x93Why Birdie?Join Birdie and seize this unique opportunity to shape the future of a transformative tech startup, to create positive social change, and develop yourself very fast in a flexible, close-knit & transparent organisation.We have a grand vision to transform how society deals with ageing, we dream big and speed is of the essence.We\xe2\x80\x99re all entrepreneurs at Birdie.We\xe2\x80\x99re highly collaborative and iterative. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.We endeavour to embrace diversity, and promote an inclusive environment for all Birdies, and actively work towards this with our Diversity & Inclusion Committee.If you have any questions regarding the interview process, or if you need any reasonable adjustments to be made, please don\xe2\x80\x99t hesitate to contact us.Compensation Range: \xc2\xa345K\n

title: Product Marketing Manager
description: \n          At Humaans, we understand that the heart of customer engagement lies in the ability to market products that not only meet but exceed expectations.The role of a Product Marketing Manager is pivotal in crafting and conveying our unique value propositions to both new and existing customers, ensuring that every interaction enhances their experience and engagement with our products. Through strategic market analysis, compelling messaging, and targeted go-to-market strategies, you will be instrumental in driving product adoption and fostering long-term relationships that contribute to our mutual success.As a Product Marketing Manager, you\'ll be at the core of our product communication strategies, working closely with our teams to launch, promote, and elevate our products. You\'ll use your insights, creativity, and analytical skills to identify market opportunities, tailor our messaging, and articulate the tangible benefits our technology brings to businesses.If you\'re passionate about making a tangible impact through strategic marketing and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we\'d love to hear from you!About UsHi, we\xe2\x80\x99re Humaans! We help globally scaling organisations transform their HR processes with a human-centric approach.At Humaans, we want to empower People teams to create a customisable HR stack by offering flexibility and scalability to seamlessly integrate with other best in class platforms and point solutions, such as Google Workplace, Slack, Okta, Greenhouse, Lattice, DocuSign and more. The stack enables companies to manage employee data, documents, contracts, reporting, and people processes that power your entire HR structure.We have raised $20 million in VC funding to date. Investors include major tech players such as Lachy Groom; Slack founder Stewart Butterfield; Shopify founder Tobias L\xc3\xbctke; Figma Founder Dylan Field; Linkedin ex-CEO Jeff Weiner; Stripe COO Claire Johnson; Y Combinator; Moonfire; Frontline Ventures; Exor and more.Our journey is only at the beginning, and we\xe2\x80\x99re looking for people excited about driving real impact. As a human centred company (quite literally), every team member counts - and that\xe2\x80\x99s where you come in.You\xe2\x80\x99re excited by:Establishing a product marketing approach designed to elevate our relationships with customers and consistently contextualize the value that we can provide to the users and businesses we partner with. Conducting in-depth market, customer, and competitor research to uncover insights and identify market opportunities that inform both positioning and product development. Taking ownership of product and feature launches, managing the process end-to-end from working with Product & Engineering to understand the value proposition, to making announcements and monitoring market adoption. Crafting and executing messaging and positioning that resonate with your target audience and clearly communicate the benefits of the platform. Being hands-on and understanding every aspect of our products, using this knowledge to drive improvements in how we go to market and distribute. Working across multiple channels to create a consistent storyline across content, ads, and sales materials. Things that will get us excited about you:A proven track record in Product Marketing within a B2B SaaS environment, especially in the Mid-Market segment. You are execution- and result-oriented, with a growth mindset focused on initiatives that drive high impact. Demonstrated experience in managing successful product launches, with a strong understanding of market dynamics and customer needs. A strong commercial mindset, capable of navigating competitive landscapes and driving long-term customer value. Experience working cross-functionally with Sales, Product, Customer Success, and Engineering teams to drive strategy and business decisions. Proven ability to translate customer insights and sales needs into Go-To-Market (GTM) fundamentals: customer segmentation, messaging, sales collateral, and more. Incredible verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to synthesize complex concepts into comprehensive and compelling narratives. Adaptability in a fast-paced environment with competing and changing priorities, ideally with experience in early-stage company growth (Series A to C stages). Package & BenefitsEarly stage startups can be messy \xe2\x80\x93 we know that. We\'re putting effort in providing you with the best employee experience and a quality driven environment in exchange for trusting us.Salary. Competitive compensation. Equity. Meaningful equity so that you own part of the company. Flexible working schedule. We\'re outcome-oriented. Time off. 25 days of paid time off per year plus public holidays. Health. Private health and dental insurance. Technology. A brand new MacBook (or whatever equipment you need). Learning and development. Budget for books and other resources you need. Our Commitment to DiversityAt Humaans we\xe2\x80\x99re looking for genuinely good people that are transparent and emphatic. We\xe2\x80\x99re committed to providing equal opportunities, a diverse and inclusive work environment, and ensuring a fair interview process for everyone. You\xe2\x80\x99re welcome to apply no matter your gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, civil or family status, age, disability, or race.Compensation Range: \xc2\xa355K - \xc2\xa365K\n

title: Marketing Manager
description: \n          The entry-level role is a thrilling opportunity to advance your Design and Creative Artwork career with comprehensive training and support from our highly experienced team, immersing you in a dynamic world where creativity meets precision. As a Creative Marketing Specialist you\'ll be at the forefront of crafting experiences for a dynamic British toy company based in Amersham, Buckinghamshire. Your canvas will be vast, ranging from creating and developing exciting and engaging B2B & B2C marketing assets within set brand identities, used for advertising, promotion, in-store, and digital channels, to supporting social media strategic post & content creation, and managing the Website. We are recruiting a Creative Marketer to join a dynamic British toy company. This role is based in Amersham, Buckinghamshire. If you\'re a creative soul with a penchant for precision, this might just be your dream job. Your role will be to breathe life into their toy brands through captivating designs, and you\'ll be an essential part of their close-knit team.Here\'s What You\'ll Be DoingCreate and develop exciting and engaging B2B & B2C marketing assets within set brand identities that our brands use for advertising, promotion, in-store, and digital use.Support social media strategic post & content creation.Manage the photography process.Knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite is vital. Exceptional organisation and communication skills, with the ability to prioritise tasks, meet deadlines, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.Ability to sketch out ideas, demonstrate a strong understanding of brand design, typography, layout, and composition.Solid understanding of design principles and experience designing for various digital platforms and channels.Creative thinking and problem-solving abilities, with a keen eye for detail and a passion for delivering exceptional design solutions. Crafted end-to-end campaigns that dazzle, from concept to production.Managed and curated an extensive image asset library.Support social media strategic post & content creation Support the management of the WebsiteManage the photography process Manage and have ownership of our extensive image asset libraries.Work Permissions: You must have the right to work in the United Kingdom. Visa sponsorship is not available at this time.Benefits Of This JobGenerous Toy DiscountLife CoverPayroll Giving PensionHigh Street & Leisure DiscountsCycle to Work schemeBirthday Leave and generous holidaysFlexible working hoursThis is a fantastic opportunity to join a tight-knit team and immerse yourself in a world of creativity and innovation. It\'s the perfect starting point for your Design and Creative Artwork career, with comprehensive training and support from our client\'s experienced team. Discover the magic of creativity meeting playfulness every day!\n

title: Marketing and Communications Manager - Windsor, Berkshire
description: \n          Lime is the world\'s largest shared electric vehicle company. We\xe2\x80\x99re on a mission to build a future where transportation is shared, affordable and carbon-free. Our electric bikes and scooters have powered 400+ million rides in 250+ cities on 5 continents, replacing an estimated 100+ million car trips. Named a Time 100 Most Influential Company and Fast Company Brand That Matters, we achieved a fully profitable year in 2022, becoming the first in our industry to reach this milestone.We are looking for a Sr. Growth Analyst to join the Rider Growth team at Lime. As our Rider Growth Analyst, you\'ll work on solving some of our most critical data challenges. You\'ll help to increase the size and value of our rider community. You\'ll develop and present professional-grade dashboards and reports. You\'ll also help design and measure key initiatives that bring in, engage, and keep Riders.What you will do:Evaluate and interpret large volumes of data, including sales, rider behavior, app performance, web traffic, and marketing campaign metrics to identify actionable insights. Develop and maintain KPI dashboards and reports to help influence Rider Growth initiatives at the strategic and tactical levelsCollaborate with cross-functional teams to design and execute experiments and scale campaigns to optimize conversion rates and increase customer acquisitionPartner closely with data science, product, and engineering to ensure data reliability. Proactively identify gaps and opportunities to streamline data accessibility and automate reporting. Own and support special projects and pilots that will significantly impact our business. About you:2 years of related experience in data analysis is required with a focus on marketing data preferred. Proven ability to influence and express complex concepts and ideas simply (written, presentation, and verbal). Advanced problem-solving and analytical skills, including expertise in Excel/Google Sheets Strong intermediate to advanced proficiency in SQL required. title: Frontend Developer
description: \n          About UsAt Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine\xe2\x80\x99s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World\xe2\x80\x99s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!About The DepartmentCloudflare\'s Network Engineering Team builds and runs the infrastructure that runs our software. The Engineering Team is split into two groups: one handles product development and the other handles operations. Product development covers both new features and functionality and scaling our existing software to meet the challenges of a massively growing customer base. The operations team handles one of the world\'s largest networks with data centers in 190 cities worldwide and a couple of large specialized data centers for internal needs.About The RoleCloudflare operates a large global network spanning hundreds of cities (data centers). You will join a team of talented network automation engineers who are building software solutions to improve network resilience and reduce engineering operational toil.You will work on a range of tools, infrastructure and services - new and existing - with an aim to elegantly and efficiently solve problems and deliver practical, maintainable and scalable solutions.Examples Of Desirable Skills, Knowledge And ExperienceBA/BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience2+ years of experience with React or equivalent frameworks (Angular, Vue)2+ years of proven experience in hands-on server-sideKnowledge of programming languages like Python or Golang.Familiarity with MySQL, Postgres (or equivalent SQL language)Experience with CI/CD, containers and/or virtualizationExperience in systems Observability.Bonus Points but not required:Professional experience with ClickHouseKnowledge of Networking engineering, with competencies in Layer 2 and Layer 3 protocols and vendor equipment: Cisco, Juniper, etc.Experience building and maintaining large distributed systemsExperience managing internal and/or external customer requirements and expectationsAvailable Locations: Lisbon or Remote Portugal, London or Remote UK, Amsterdam or Remote Netherlands, Germany or MunichWhat Makes Cloudflare Special?We\xe2\x80\x99re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We\xe2\x80\x99re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.Project Galileo : We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare\xe2\x80\x99s enterprise customers--at no cost. Athenian Project  : We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.Path Forward Partnership : Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.1.1.1.1 : We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here\xe2\x80\x99s the deal - we don\xe2\x80\x99t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.Sound like something you\xe2\x80\x99d like to be a part of? We\xe2\x80\x99d love to hear from you!This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person\'s, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.\n
